entry.title: Neutron channelling in a magnetic tube trap
entry.summary: Neutron channelling in a magnetic tube trap is discussed

entry.title: Spin and Flavour: Concluding Remarks
entry.summary: Summmary talk at the Workshop on Sin and Flavour in Hadronic and Electromagnetic Interactions, Turin (Italy), september 1992, to appear in the Proceedings,
entry.arxiv:comment: 13pages, ISN 93-17

entry.title: Neutrino-Nucleus Reactions
entry.summary: Neutrino-nucleus reactions as applied to astrophysics are reviewed.

entry.title: Color Transparency Assumptions
entry.summary: An exactly solvable model is used to investigate the assumptions behind color transparency.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, latex, 8 figures

entry.title: REGULAR SUPPRESSION OF P,T-VIOLATING NUCLEAR MATRIX ELEMENTS
entry.summary: In heavy nuclei there is a parametrical suppression, $\;\sim A^{-1/3}\;$, of T-odd, P-odd matrix elements as compared to T-even, P-odd ones.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages

entry.title: Importance of core polarization in halo nuclei
entry.summary: A comment on the importance of core polarization in halo nuclei. I point out that although core polarization is suppressed in neutron halos, it plays an essential role in their binding mechanism.

entry.title: Instanton tunneling and multiphonon giant resonances
entry.summary: The sine-Gordon model is applied to describe the multiphonon giant resonances.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, LATEX, 1 figure

entry.title: Weak Chiral Lagrangian and $pi^+$ Emission in ${}^4_{Lambda}$He
entry.summary: A new mechanism of $pi^+$ meson emission from the ${}^4_{Lambda}$He hypernucleus is suggested.

entry.title: Initial Conditions for Parton Cascades
entry.summary: I discuss the initial conditions for a parton cascade.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 2 figures, LATEX

entry.title: Free volume in microcanonical multifragmentation
entry.summary: A modified version is in preparation.

entry.title: Solving the pairing problem with exact particle number conservation
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Magnetic instability of quark matter
entry.summary: Spontaneous magnetization of quark liquid is examined. It is pointed out that quark liquid has potential to be ferromagnetic at rather low densities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 page, 3 figures

entry.title: Double Beta Decay: Theory, Experiment, and Implications
entry.summary: The theory, experimental status, and implications of double beta decay are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages including 4 figures. Chapter 8 of the book ``Current Aspects of Neutrino Physics'', D. O. Caldwell, editor

entry.title: Comment on "Negative heat ..." by Moretto et al
entry.summary: The recent paper nucl-th/0012037 by Moretto et al. is commented
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, no figure, LATEX file

entry.title: BBGKY Hierarchy in Scalar QFT
entry.summary: This work is dedicated to obtaining of analog of Bogoliubov's chain for the case of complex scalar field in QFT and renormalization problem of obtained equations is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Comment on "Forward K+ production in subthreshold pA collisions at 1.0 GeV"
entry.summary: A Comment on the letter by V. Koptev, et al. - Phys. Rev. Lett. 87 (2001) 022301.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 Pages, 1 figure (epsfig)

entry.title: Transition from the superfluid phase to the normal phase in nuclei far from stability
entry.summary: To be replaced with a revised version.

entry.title: Muon catalysis of superheavy element production in nucleus-nucleus fusion reaction
entry.summary: It is shown that muon bound with light projectile induces the superheavy elements production in nucleus-nucleus collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 1 table, RevTex style

entry.title: Higher spin hadrons as relativistic fields
entry.summary: I discuss the problem of consistent interactions of higher-spin fields and its relevance to resonance physics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, invited talk at NSTAR 2002 Workshop, Pittsburgh, USA, October 9-12, 2002

entry.title: Projector operators for the no-core shell model
entry.summary: Projection operators for the use within ab initio no-core shell model, are suggested.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages

entry.title: Parameterization of the phase shift D33 for Pion-Nucleon Scattering
entry.summary: This paper is withdrawn.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper is withdrawn

entry.title: Hard Probes at LHC
entry.summary: This talk gives a theoretical perspective of the physics issues awaiting us when heavy ions will collide in the LHC.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at Hard Probes 2006

entry.title: Reply to comment ``On the test of the modified BCS at finite temperature''
entry.summary: This is our formal Reply to revised version (v2) of arXiv: nucl-th/0510004v2.
entry.arxiv:comment: accepted in Physical Review C

entry.title: Neutrino Properties, Cosmology
entry.summary: Review of neutrino properties; double beta decay; very high energy neutrinos; leptogenesis
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 3 figures; conference talk

entry.title: Simplified Version of the Nucleon and Delta-Isobar Description
entry.summary: Considering synchronous spin-isospin rotation as a collective motion a simplified scheme of the nucleon and delta isobar description is formulated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Dynamical Coupled-Channels Analysis at EBAC
entry.summary: The status of dynamical coupled-channel analysis at Excited Baryon Analysis Center (EBAC) of Jefferson Laboratory is reported.

entry.title: Three-nucleon interactions: dynamics
entry.summary: A discussion is presented of the dynamics underlying three-body nuclear forces, with emphasis on changes which occurred over several decades.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at the FM50 symposium, Tokyo, October 2007

entry.title: Elie: an event generator for nuclear reactions
entry.summary: An event generator for the description of nuclear reactions in the Fermi energy range is briefly introduced and first comparisons with experimental data are shown.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to the IWM2007 Workshop-GANIL

entry.title: TDHFB-Langevin approach to the nuclear collective dynamics
entry.summary: A restricted TDHFB-Langevin formalism is presented, and applied to estimate the nuclear shape diffusion coefficient.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: "Large-Scale Collective Motion of Atomic Nuclei", World Scientific, Singapore, 1997, p. 222

entry.title: Poincaré invariant quantum theory, J. Lab lectures
entry.summary: Lectures on Poincare invariant quantum theory presented at TJNAF.
entry.arxiv:comment: 54 pages

entry.title: Astrophysical Neutrino Reactions and Muon Capture in Deuterium
entry.summary: We discuss the importance of precise study of muon capture in deuterium for correct understanding of some fundamental astrophysical processes
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: Fusion11 Conference Summary
entry.summary: A summary account of the conference "Fusion11", held in Saint Malo, France, May 2-6, 2011.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 13 figures

entry.title: A microscopic equation of state for neutron-rich matter and its effect on neutron star properties
entry.summary: Chapter prepared for the book "Astrophysics", ISBN 979-953-307-389-6, INTECH Publishers (in press).
entry.arxiv:comment: 34 pages, 20 figures

entry.title: Mass asymmetry effects on multifragmentation
entry.summary: Mass asymmetry effects on multifragmentation.
entry.arxiv:comment: DAE Symposium on Nuclear Physics, December 26-30, 2011, Department of Nuclear Physics, Andhra University, Visakhapatnam, A.P., India

entry.title: Clustering of energy levels
entry.summary: It is noted that in single j-shell calculations certain odd-spin states in even--even nuclei lie in a narrow energy band; likewise certain states in odd--odd nuclei.

entry.title: Spin in relativistic quantum theory
entry.summary: We discuss the role of spin in Poincar\'e invariant formulations of quantum mechanics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 54 pages

entry.title: Progress in Euclidean relativistic few-body quantum mechanics
entry.summary: We discuss recent progress in the Euclidean formulation of relativistic few-body quantum mechanics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, contribution to LC2012, Krakow, Poland

entry.title: How degeneracies can obscure interesting physics
entry.summary: We show how degeneracies, accidental or otherwise, can obscure some interesting physics. We further show how one can get around this problem.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: romanian journal of physics, Volume 58, Number 9-10, 2013 ,1064

entry.title: Incompleteness of complete kaon photoproduction
entry.summary: A possible roadmap for reaching a status of complete information in $\gamma p \rightarrow K^ {+} \Lambda$ is outlined.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 2 figures, Proceedings of the NSTAR2013 conference

entry.title: Spectra and Electromagnetic Properties of the Neutron-Excess Nucleus $^{132}$In
entry.summary: Spectra of levels and transition rates are calculated for the odd--odd particle--hole neutron excess nucleus $^{132}$In in the framework of the RPA approach.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages

entry.title: SQM2016: Theory Summary
entry.summary: This is an overview of the main theoretical developments presented at SQM2016 held in Berkeley, California (USA) in June 2015.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, no figures

entry.title: Comment on "Spreading widths of giant resonances in spherical nuclei: damped transient response" by Severyukhin et al. [arXiv:1703.05710]
entry.summary: We argue whether physics of universal approach of Severyukhin et al. [arXiv:1703.05710] is approved.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page, 1 figure

entry.title: Effective relativistic mean field model for finite nuclei and neutron stars
entry.summary: New Relativistic mean field parameter set IOPB-I has been developed.

entry.title: Coalescence, Percolation and Nuclear Multifragmentation
entry.summary: We show that the coalescence model for fragment formation leads to an approximate site percolation model. Features characteristic of a percolation model also appear in microscopic models of disassembly.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, LaTeX file, 3 Postscript figs available on request

entry.title: Pre-equilibrium dileptons look thermal
entry.summary: The dilepton mass distribution from pre-equilibrium matter in ultrarelativistic nuclear collisions is indistinguishable from a thermally produced distribution.

author.name: David Seibert
author.arxiv:affiliation: Theory Division, CERN, CH-1211 Geneva 23, Switzerland

author.name: Tanguy Altherr
author.arxiv:affiliation: Theory Division, CERN, CH-1211 Geneva 23, Switzerland

entry.arxiv:comment: CERN-TH.6813/93, 3 pages (latex) plus 1 figure (uuencoded postscript file)

entry.title: Relation between the phenomenological interactions of the algebraic cluster model and the effective two--nucleon forces
entry.summary: We determine the phenomenological cluster--cluster interactions of the algebraic model corresponding to the most often used effective two--nucleon forces for the $^{16}$O + $\alpha$ system.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex with Revtex, 1 figure available on request

entry.title: Light front dynamics and the binding correction
entry.summary: It is shown that the nuclear binding correction in deep inelastic lepton scattering is essentially the same in light front and instant form representations. Some contradicting papers are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, LATEX file.(address from April 21: Institute for Nuclear Research, Moscow)

entry.title: The column vector calculus for Thermo Field Dynamics of relativistic quantum fields
entry.summary: A formalism is discussed which simplifies the calculation of Feynman diagrams at finite temperature.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, GSI-Preprint 93-32 (1993)

entry.title: Quantum fragmentation
entry.summary: Phenomenological and theoretical aspects of fragmentation for elementary particles (resp. nuclei) are discussed. It is shown that some concepts of classical fragmentation remain relevant in a microscopic framework, exhibiting non-trivial properties of quantum relativistic field theory (resp. lattice percolation). Email contact: pesch@amoco.saclay.cea.fr
entry.arxiv:comment: Saclay-T93/075 Email: pesch@amoco.saclay.cea.fr

entry.title: An antiproton-proton partial wave analysis
entry.summary: Invited talk presented by the first author at the XIVth European Conference of Few-Body Problems in Physics, Amsterdam, August 23-28, 1993
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages LaTeX, one postscript figure appended, THEF-NYM-93.13

entry.title: Spectral asymmetries in nucleon sum rules at finite density
entry.summary: Apparent inconsistencies between different formulations of nucleon sum rules at finite density are resolved through a proper accounting of asymmetries in the spectral functions between positive- and negative-energy states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages in RevTeX, OSU-0901

entry.title: QCD Evolution by Finite Element Methods
entry.summary: A simple, new method for solving for the $Q^2$ evolution of parton distributions in perturbative QCD using cubic splines is described and applied to the evolution of nonsinglet quark distributions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, LA-UR-94-236

entry.title: Stochastic Methods for Quantum Scattering
entry.summary: Quantum scattering at zero energy is studied with stochastic methods. A path integral representation for the scattering cross section is developed. It is demonstrated that Monte Carlo simulation can be used to compare effective potentials which are frequently used in multiple scattering with the exact result.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4pages

entry.title: The Balian-Brézin Method in Relativistic Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: The method suggested by Balian and Br\'ezin for treating angular momentum reduction in the Faddeev equations is shown to be applicable to the relativistic three-body problem.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages in LaTeX

entry.title: Nuclear-Spin-Dependent Parity-Nonconserving Effects in Thallium, Lead and Bismuth Atoms
entry.summary: Nuclear-spin-dependent P-odd optical activity in atomic Tl, Pb and Bi is calculated. Its magnitude is expressed analytically through the main contribution to the optical rotation, which is independent of nuclear spin. The accuracy of results is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, BINP 94--56

entry.title: Forms of Relativistic Dynamics: What Are the Possibilities?
entry.summary: Various methods of constructing solvable few-body models are reviewed, with an emphasis on direct interactions with few degrees of freedom, as an alternative to the use of local quantum field theories. Several applications are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pp

entry.title: Color Transparency Effects in Quasi-elastic Nuclear Reactions
entry.summary: Previous work on color transparency is reviewed briefly with an emphasis on aspects related to an upgrade of CEBAF.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, Report # DOE/ER/40427-12-N94, to be published in the Proceedings of CEBAF Workshop "CEBAF at Higher Energies"

entry.title: Inclusive Aand Semi-Inclusive Deep Inelastic Scattering at Cebaf at Higher Energies
entry.summary: We summarize the discussion on the possibilities of doing inclusive and semi-inclusive deep inelastic scattering experiments at CEBAF with beam energy of the order of 10 GeV.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages (latex), 1 figure (available on request), NIKHEF-K 94-P6

entry.title: Nuclear Multifragmentation Critical Exponents
entry.summary: We show that the critical exponents of nuclear multi-fragmentation have not been determined conclusively yet.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LaTeX, one postscript figure appended, sub. to Phys.Rev.Lett. as a comment

entry.title: Scaling with no phase transition
entry.summary: The observation of scaling relations in ultra-relativistic nuclear collisions would not by itself signal that the hot matter produced in these collisions has passed through a phase transition.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, revtex, no figures

entry.title: Heavy Resonance Production in Ultrarelativistic Nuclear Collisions
entry.summary: Are heavy quarks produced thermally or only by hard parton collisions? What is the probability that a produced heavy quark or antiquark is observed in a given resonance?
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages (latex), no figures

entry.title: Quark Matter 95: Concluding Remarks
entry.summary: Highlights of Quark Matter 95 are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, latex, 9 uuencoded figures, revised text

entry.title: Effective Field Theories
entry.summary: Three lectures on effective field theory given at the Seventh Summer School in Nuclear Physics, Seattle June 19-30 1995.
entry.arxiv:comment: 40 pages uuencoded with figures; requires macros harvmac, epsf.tex

entry.title: About the decay of the $Λ$ in a nucleus
entry.summary: A few aspects of the $\Lambda$ mesonic and non-mesonic decay in nuclei are shortly addressed.

author.name: W. M. Alberico

author.name: M. B. Barbaro

entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 4 figures (hardcopy available on request)

entry.title: Can Plane Wave Modes be Physical Modes in Soliton Models?
entry.summary: I show that plane waves may not be used as asymptotic states in soliton models because they describe unphysical states. When asymptotic states are taken to be physical there is no T-matrix of $\cO(1)$.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex. Published in Phys. Lett. B

entry.title: Meson-hyperon couplings in the bound-state approach to the Skyrme model
entry.summary: Strong pion and kaon couplings to hyperons are given in the bound-state approach to the Skyrme model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 26 pages

entry.title: Nonlinearities of the Vlasov equation in the spinodal region
entry.summary: We estimate the importance of the nonlinear terms in the Vlasov equation for the development of the unstable modes. The results allow to identify the region of wavelength where the linear evolution is justified.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 3 figures included, uses epsfig

entry.title: Comment on Final State Interactions beyond the Plane Wave Impulse Approximation description of inclusive scattering
entry.summary: It is shown that no set of reasonable assumptions leads to a structure function as a convolution of the PWIA and a FSI contribution.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, TeX file

entry.title: The Chiral Phase Transition
entry.summary: I review the current understanding of the chiral phase transition in QCD, with particular emphasis on recent results obtained in the instanton liquid model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 9 PS figures, to appear in QM96 proceedings (Nucl. Phys. A)

entry.title: Coulomb Effect on phi->K+K- Invariant Mass
entry.summary: We demonstrate that coulomb interaction between a static charge source and K+ and K- from phi-meson decay could introduce systematic shift in the phi invariant mass reconstructed from the K+K- pair.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 8 figures in a single file

entry.title: A functional approach to nuclear electromagnetic response functions
entry.summary: The separated electromagnetic responses $R_L(q,\omega)$ and $R_T(q,\omega)$ for inclusive electron scattering off nuclei are studied within a functional scheme.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, ReVTeX, with figures included as epsfiles

entry.title: New Type of Collective Motion for N $\sim$ Z Nuclei
entry.summary: We study a new type of collective motion with alpha-particle type of correlations and show that it may be relevant for N $\sim$ Z nuclei.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, latex, one figure given on request, LA-UR-96-997

entry.title: The Dirac-Brueckner Approach
entry.summary: In this review, we give a thorough introduction into the Dirac-Brueckner approach including the mathematical details of the formalism involved. Furthermore, we present results for nuclear matter, NN scattering in the nuclear medium, and finite nuclei.
entry.arxiv:comment: 49 pages, LaTeX, 9 figures, psfig style

entry.title: Meson Photoproductions of Nucleon In the Quark Model
entry.summary: The meson photoproductions off nucleons in the chiral quark model are described. The role of the S-wave resonances in the second resonance region is discussed, and it is particularly important for the Kaon, $\eta$ and $\eta'$ photoproductions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex 11 pages, 1 ps fig. Talk at CEBAF/INT Workshop on N* physics

entry.title: (Anti-) Deuteron Coalescence in Ultrarelativistic Heavy Ion Collisions
entry.summary: In the frame of the Wigner function formalism, we derive a coalescence model to use with a hydrodynamical picture of the reaction zone
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in "GSI Yearly Reports 96", 1 page Latex, needs style-file "gsirep.sty"

entry.title: E2/M1 ratio from the Mainz $p(\vec γ, p)π^0$ data
entry.summary: We suggest that the error quoted in the Mainz determination of the E2/M1 ratio (at the resonance energy) should be enlarged. A term dropped in expressions used by this group could be significant.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages of text. Submitted to the Comments section of PRL

entry.title: Bose-Einstein Weights for Event Generators
entry.summary: A simple new algorithm for the calculation of two-particle Bose-Einstein correlations from classical event generators is derived and discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, RevTeX, one ps-figure

entry.title: Low-energy Antiproton Interaction with Helium
entry.summary: An ab initio potential for the interaction of the neutral helium atom with antiprotons and protons is calculated using the Born-Oppenheimer approximation. Using this potential, the annihilation cross section for antiprotons in the energy range 0.01 microvolt to 1 eV is calculated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 7 figures, LaTeX

entry.title: Shell Effects in Mesoscopic Systems
entry.summary: The main aim of the results presented here is to demonstrate and analyse the importance of shell effects in nuclei, metallic clusters and quantum dots.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, latex Invited talk at the International Conference "Nuclear Structure and Related Topics", Dubna, Russia, September 9-14, 1997

entry.title: Comment on ``Pionic decay of a possible d' dibaryon and the short-range NN interaction''
entry.summary: We comment on calculations of the width of the d' resonance within framework of quark shell models.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, Revtex, submitted to Phys. Rev. C

entry.title: Cluster Production in Ultrarelativistic Heavy Ion Collisions
entry.summary: Cluster production in ultrarelativistic heavy ion collision may prove an interesting tool to extract physical quantities of the fireball.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in GSI Yearly Reports 97, 1 page Latex, needs style-file "gsirep.sty" (provided)

entry.title: Electrons and Nuclei: Fundamental Interactions and Structure
entry.summary: Examples are given of the usefulness of electrons in interaction with nuclei for probing fundamental interactions and structure
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, latex; figures available on request. Talk give on occasion of 100th. anniversary of electron at Frascati

entry.title: Hadronic Observables: Theoretical Highlights
entry.summary: I present highlights from the parallel sessions on the theory of hadronic observables in e^+ e^-, hadronic and nuclear reactions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at the Quark Matter'97 meeting, Tsukuba, Japan, December 1-5, 1997. To be published in the proceedings

entry.title: Nonperturbative Flow Equations at Finite Temperature
entry.summary: Nonperturbative Flow Equations within an effective constituent quark model for two quark flavors with Heat-Kernel methods are studied.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in GSI Yearly Reports 97, 1 page LaTeX, needs gsirep.sty (provided)

entry.title: Exponential Potential for Nucleon-Nucleon Interaction with forbidden states
entry.summary: An exponential version of a deep nucleon-nucleon potential involving forbidden states and a tensor component is proposed. The parameters of interaction are chosen by fitting the low-energy characteristics and phase shifts of np scattering at energies up to 500 MeV.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 4 figures, 6 references

entry.title: Pion Correlations and Two-Particle Bound States
entry.summary: A method to investigate possible loosely bound dibaryon states is suggested. The momentum dependence of a two-pion correlation function is shown to depend on the (non)existence of a bound state.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Nucleon Axial Matrix Elements
entry.summary: Current issues associated with nucleon axial matrix elements are studied, including the Goldberger-Treiman discrepancy, the induced pseudoscalar, and SU(3) chiral perturbation theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at ECT/CEBAF Workshop on N* Workshop and Nonperturbative QCD, Trento, May 1998

entry.title: Saturnalia
entry.summary: A personal choice is made of the highlights of the physics programme carried out at the Saturne-2 facility over the last twenty years.
entry.arxiv:comment: Concluding talk at "les 20 ans de Saturne-2" colloquium, Paris, 5 May 1998. 8 pages. French version entitled "Saturnales" also available

entry.title: Saturnales
entry.summary: Un choix personnel a ete fait d'evenements memorables du programme de physique realise a Saturne-2 pendant les derniers 20 ans.
entry.arxiv:comment: Concluding talk at "les 20 ans de Saturne-2" colloquium, Paris, 5 May 1998. 9 pages in French - English version available as nucl-th/9806075

entry.title: On the three-body continuum spectrum of He-6
entry.summary: In recent publications Cobis, Fedorov, and Jensen claim the existence of several previously unknown low-lying narrow resonances in He-6. I show that the distribution of the S-matrix poles corresponding to these states is unphysical. This casts doubt on the results of those works concerning resonances.

entry.title: What Effective Field Theory May Contribute to the Blast Program
entry.summary: Recent progress in using effective field theory to describe two nucleon systems is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, 10 figures, latex, sprocl.sty: Talk presented at the ``Second Workshop on Electronuclear Physics with Internal Targets and the Bates Large Acceptance Spectrometer Toroid (BLAST)'', May 1998

entry.title: Particle production from off-shell nucleons
entry.summary: Particle production in equilibrium and nonequilibrium quantum systems is calculated. The effects of the off-shell propagation of nucleons in medium on the particle production are discussed. Comparision to the semiclassical production rate is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: talk given at the V Workshop on the Nonequilibrium Physics at Short Time Scales, April 1998, Rostock, Germany, 4 pages

entry.title: Reply on Toke's and Schroeder's comment on our paper "Statistical nature of multifragmentation"
entry.summary: We point out some basic misunderstandings and wrong statements about our microcanonical Metropolis Monte Carlo (MMMC) model of nuclear fragmentation.
entry.arxiv:comment: Reply on the comment by Toke and Schroeder nucl-th/9807066

entry.title: Introduction to light cone field theory and high energy scattering
entry.summary: In this set of four lectures, we provide an elementary introduction to light cone field theory and some of its applications in high energy scattering.
entry.arxiv:comment: 28 pages, LaTeX, invited lectures at Cape Town summer school in theoretical physics

entry.title: Coefficients of Fractional Parentage for Nuclear Shell Model
entry.summary: A new procedure for the calculation of shell model coefficients of fractional parentage has been developed. This procedure is free of numerical diagonalization, orthogonalization, and even of grop theoretical classification of antisymmetric states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Fluid Dynamics for Relativistic Nuclear Collisions
entry.summary: I give an introduction to the basic concepts of fluid dynamics as applied to the dynamical description of relativistic nuclear collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 49 pages, 22 figures, style files, Proceedings of the 11th Chris Engelbrecht Summer School in Theoretical Physics, Cape Town, February 4-13, 1998

entry.title: Stability of the E2/M1 ratio at the T-matrix pole
entry.summary: We show how the stability of the E2/M1 ratio, evaluated at the T-matrix pole, can be understood given a much wider variation at the K-matrix pole.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages of text

entry.title: Impressionism and Surrealism in Multiparticle Dynamics
entry.summary: Invited talk at the CORR98 meeting on Correlations, M\'atrah\'aza, June 1998, to appear in the proceedings of the meeting in World Scientific. This talk is dedicated to the memory of Peter Carruthers.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages

entry.title: Final state interaction in near-threshold meson production
entry.summary: We address the question what information, other than the Final State Interaction parameters, one can extract from data on near-threshold meson production.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, LaTeX, including 2 ps-figures. To be pub. Acta Physica Polonica B

entry.title: Having a BLAST with Excited Baryons
entry.summary: We discuss the role BLAST can play in the valuable kinematic window of low W and low Q^2.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, sprocl.sty, 2 figs. Contribution to MIT BLAST workshop

entry.title: Questions on the Quark Model: Panel Discussion
entry.summary: We discuss the effect of model space truncation on current conservation in quark model calculations.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, fbssuppl.sty. Contribution to Trento N* workshop

entry.title: On the behaviour of the nuclear spectral function at high momentum and removal energy
entry.summary: The extrapolation of the nuclear spectral function at large nucleon three-momentum and removal energy is suggested.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 2 Postscript figures

entry.title: Electromagnetic form factors of baryons
entry.summary: Nucleon elastic and transition form factors are analyzed in the framework of a collective model of baryons. Effects of meson cloud couplings and relativistic corrections are considered.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, contribution to proceedings of Baryons '98, Bonn, September 22-26, 1998

entry.title: P- and T-violation Tests with Polarized Resonance Neutrons
entry.summary: The enhancements of CP-violating effects in resonance neutron transmissionthrough polarized targets are studied for 2 possible versions of experiment. The importance is stressed of error analysis and of pseudomagnetic effects' compensation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, LaTeX + 4 PostScript figures

entry.title: Remark to ''On the Description of Fermion Systems in Boson Representations''
entry.summary: The formulae of boson powers commutation relation used by B. Sorensen [Nucl. Phys. A, v. 119, No 1, (1968), 65] in his calculations is erroneous. We provide the correct formulae.
entry.arxiv:comment: Revtex, 2 pages, no figures

entry.title: Quantum Münchhausen effect in tunneling
entry.summary: It is demonstrated that radiative corrections increase tunneling probability of a charged particle.

entry.title: Effective Field Theory for Nuclear Physics
entry.summary: I summarize the motivation for the effective field theory approach to nuclear physics, and highlight some of its recent accomplishments. The results are compared with those computed in potential models.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk delivered at Baryons '98, Bonn, Sept. 22, 1998. 15 pages, 9 figures

entry.title: Hadronic Atoms and Effective Interactions
entry.summary: We examine the problem of hadronic atom energy shifts using the technique of effective interactions and demonstrate equivalence with the conventional quantum mechanical approach.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 page latex file with 2 figures

entry.title: Delta-N Electromagnetic Transition
entry.summary: The EM ratio for a free Delta electromagnetic transition is discussed within the frame work of nonrelativistic approach. Such an approach gives a good account of data for a free Delta but is less important for an intrinsically relativistic nuclear many body problem.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, RevTeX

entry.title: The neutron distribution in nuclei as measured with parity violating electron scattering
entry.summary: A short review of the present knowledge of the nucleons distribution in nuclei is given. A proposal is made about a possible measurements of the neutron distribution through polarized electron scattering off nuclei.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: Historical Survey of the Quasi-Nuclear Baryonium
entry.summary: We review ideas and speculations concerning possible bound states or resonances of the nucleon--antinucleon system.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, Talk at the Workshop on Hadron Spectroscopy, Frascati, Italy, march 1999

entry.title: About Atomic Structure of Nucleon
entry.summary: The comparison of magnetic moments of neutron and proton reveals three possible states of a nucleon. The arguments are presented why these states can be the stationary states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages

entry.title: Parity violation through color superconductivity
entry.summary: We give a pedagogical discussion of how color superconductivity can produce parity violation in cold quark matter at very high densities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, LaTeX, to appear in Proc. of QM'99 conference

entry.title: T-odd particle spin rotation in nuclear target
entry.summary: It is shown that particle spin rotation in nuclear target, caused by the imaginary part of the spin-dependent forward scattering amplitude, is T-odd rotation.

author.name: S. L. Cherkas
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Nuclear Problems, Minsk, Belarus

entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 3 pages

entry.title: Effective Field Theory and Nuclear Mean-Field Models
entry.summary: The implications of an effective field theory (EFT) interpretation of nuclear mean-field phenomenology are reviewed.

entry.title: Flow and equation of state in heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: The status of flow in heavy-ion collisions and of inference of hadronic-matter properties is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 12 figures, talk given at Quark Matter '99, Torino, Italy

entry.title: Color superconductivity: Continuity of quark and hadron matter, the role of the strange quark mass, and perturbative results
entry.summary: We summarize some recent results on the structure of QCD at very high baryon density.

entry.title: The Pion Electroproduction in the $Δ$(1232) region region
entry.summary: The amplitudes of the pion electroproduction from the nucleon are derived up to third order in the chiral effective theory including explicit $\Delta$(1232) >. The Q^2 evolutions of weighted integrals of amplitudes are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, no figures

entry.title: Color Superconductivity
entry.summary: We discuss recent results on color superconductivity in QCD at large chemical potential.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in the Proceedings of the 10th International Conference on Recent Progress in Many-Body Theories (MBX), Seattle, WA, 10-15 Sep 1999, R. F. Bishop et al. (eds.), World Scientific (Singapore)

entry.title: Tables of internal conversion coefficients for superheavy elements
entry.summary: The internal conversion coefficients for the elements 104 <= Z <= 126 are presented.

entry.title: Parity Nonconservation in the Deuteron Photodisintegration
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages

entry.title: Prediction of nuclear reaction rates for astrophysics
entry.summary: This is an overview over the prediction of astrophysical reaction rates in the statistical model, with special emphasis on the parametrization of optical alpha+nucleus potentials.

author.name: T. Rauscher
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dept. of Physics and Astronomy, University of Basel, Switzerland

entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. IX workshop "Nuclear Astrophysics", eds. W. Hillebrandt, E. Mueller (MPA/P10, Garching 1998), p. 84

entry.title: Review of existing breakup and transfer theories leading to continuum final states
entry.summary: This is a brief review of recent experimental and theoretical works aiming at extracting spectroscopic information from quasielasic projectile breakup reactions at intermediate energies.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, pdf file including 5 figures

entry.title: Phase Transitions in Dense Matter and Recent Topics of Neutron Stars
entry.summary: Core of neutron star consists of highly dense matter above normal nuclear density, where phase transitions is expected to take place. We review some phase transitions and recent topics of neutron stars.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11pages, 14figures, Contribution to the Proceedings of "Tours2000" Sept.4-7, 2000, Tours, France

entry.title: Peripheral Collisions of Relativistic Heavy Ions
entry.summary: The physics of peripheral collisions with relativistic heavy ions (PCRHI) is reviewed. One- and two-photon processes are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 5 figures, In memory of Michael Danos

entry.title: Photonic Probes of the Deuteron in Effective Field Theory
entry.summary: I give a taste of recent progress in using chiral perturbation theory to understand nucleon and deuteron structure.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages LaTeX and sprocl.sty, 2 figures

entry.title: Polarization observables in the reaction $p n \to d φ$
entry.summary: The reaction $p n \to d \phi$ is studied within a covariant boson exchange model. The behavior of polarization observables being accessible in forthcoming experiments near threshold is predicted.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages

entry.title: Broad Band Equilibration of Strangeness
entry.summary: We develop the "broad band equilibration" scenario for kaon productions at GSI energies with in-medium effects.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, latex with 2 eps figure, a talk in QM2001

entry.title: One and Two-photon Physics with Relativistic Heavy Ions
entry.summary: The physics of peripheral collisions with relativistic heavy ions (PCRHI) is reviewed. One- and two-photon processes are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, Invited talk at the 17th Winter Workshop on Nuclear Dynamics, Park City, Utah, March 10-17, 2002

entry.title: Electroweak Probes and Nuclear Effective Field Theory
entry.summary: There is growing interest in nuclear physics applications of effective field theory. I give a brief account of some of the latest developments in this area. I also describe interplay between this new approach and the traditional nuclear physics approach.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex file 6 pages

entry.title: Meson Properties in Dense Hadronic Matter
entry.summary: The medium modification of mesons in dense hadronic matter is discussed with a focus on the relationship to the chiral structure of the non-perturbative QCD vacuum.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proc. Third Int. Conf. on "Perspectives in Nuclear Physics", Trieste 2001 8pages+5figures

entry.title: Multipole analysis for pion photoproduction with MAID and a dynamical models
entry.summary: Results of new analysis of pion photoproduction data obtained with Dynamical and MAID models are presented
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 1 figure, talk given at the NSTAR2001 Workshop, Mainz, Germany, March 7-10, 2001

entry.title: The mean energy, strength and width of triple giant dipole resonances
entry.summary: We investigate the mean energy, strength and width of the triple giant dipole resonance using sum rules.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages

entry.title: Strange Goings on in Quark Matter
entry.summary: We review recent work on how the superfluid state of three flavor quark matter is affected by non-zero quark masses and chemical potentials.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages. To appear in the proceedings of 6th Workshop on Non-Perturbative QCD, Paris, France, 5-9 Jun 2001

entry.title: Relativistic Pseudospin Symmetry in Nuclei
entry.summary: We review recent developments that show that pseudospin symmetry is an approximate relativistic symmetry of the Dirac Hamiltonian with realistic nuclear mean field potentials.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 5 figures, Proc. NATO Advanced Research Workshop, The Nuclear Many-Body Problem 2001, Brijuni, Pula, Croatia, June 2-5, 2001

entry.title: Calculation of the number of partitions with constraints on the fragment size
entry.summary: This article introduces recursive relations allowing the calculation of the number of partitions with constraints on the minimum and/or on the maximum fragment size.

entry.title: Doorway states for one-nucleon transfer reactions as a test for current approaches to nuclei
entry.summary: The naturalness concept of the effective field theory is not confirmed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, Latex, etc), 1 figure, epsfig used

entry.title: Gluonic excitations in lattice QCD: A brief survey
entry.summary: Our current knowledge about glueballs and hybrid mesons from lattice QCD simulations is briefly reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 8 figures, plenary talk at Hadron 2001 (Protvino, Russia), uses the AIP macros, fig 1 corrected

entry.title: Relativistic quantum transport theory for heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: Microscopic Models for the Particle-Vibration Coupling in Exotic Nuclei
entry.summary: Recent results obtained, often in fruitful collaboration with Japanese colleagues in the study of the interplay between single-particle and collective degrees of freedom are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages. Proceedings of the Italy-Japan Meeting On Heavy Ion Physics 2001

entry.title: Low Mass Dileptons from Pb+Au Collisions at 158 AGeV
entry.summary: The medium modification of vector meson properties in hot/dense hadronic matter and its role in explaining the CERES/NA45 dilepton data at different centralities are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at ICPA-QGP, Jaipur, November 2001

entry.title: Dynamical Effects beyond Mean Field in Drip Line Nuclei
entry.summary: New structure problems are raised in nuclei near drip lines by recent RIB experiments. We pointed out the importance of dynamical effect beyond mean field theories to the new structure problems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6pages, 3figures

entry.title: On "the authentic damping mechanism" of the phonon damping model
entry.summary: Some general features of the phonon damping model are presented. It is concluded that the fits performed within this model have no physical content.

entry.title: On "the authentic damping mechanism" of the phonon damping model. II
entry.summary: This article continues a discussion raised in previous publications (LANL preprint server, nucl-th/0202006 and nucl-th/0202020). I try to convince my opponents that general arguments are not "my case" and may be applied to their model.

entry.title: Bulk Nuclear Properties from Reactions
entry.summary: Extraction of bulk nuclear properties by comparing reaction observables to results from semiclassical transport-model simulations is discussed. Specific properties include the nuclear viscosity, incompressibility and constraints on the nuclear pressure at supranormal densities.
entry.arxiv:comment: talk given at XV Int. Winter Meeting on Nuclear Physics, Bormio (Italy), Jan. 21-26, 2002, 15 pages, 15 figures

entry.title: On the polarization effects in (p,n) reactions between the A=48 isobarical states
entry.summary: Isotopical dependence of spin-orbit splitting discovered by us in spectra of heavy nuclei close to doubly magic ones is checked in polarization effects arising in charge exchange (p,n) reaction between the A=48 isobarical states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Latex, 1 fig, epsfig

entry.title: Hydrodynamics at RHIC
entry.summary: The hydrodynamical models used to describe the evolution of heavy-ion collisions are briefly reviewed and their results compared with recent RHIC data.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to the proceedigns of the Cracow Epiphany Conference on quarks and gluons in extreme conditions. 16 pages, 9 figures, uses appolb.cls

entry.title: Quark interchange effects in the KN interaction
entry.summary: We study the short range repulsion in the KN system due to quark-gluon exchange. Phase shifts for spin-spin, color Coloumb and spin-orbit interactions are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Proceedings of VIII Hadron Physics 2002

entry.title: Further comments on nuclear forces in the chiral limit
entry.summary: We substantiate our statement that the deuteron remains bound in the chiral limit. We critically discuss recent claims that effective field theory cannot give a definite answer to this question.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pp, LaTeX2e, 2 figures

entry.title: An Introduction to the Interacting Boson Model of the Atomic Nucleus. Part II
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: 87 pages, 17 line figures, pdf

entry.title: Three-body monopole corrections to the realistic interactions
entry.summary: It is shown that a very simple three-body monopole term can solve practically all the spectroscopic problems--in the $p$, $sd$ and $pf$ shells--that were hitherto assumed to need drastic revisions of the realistic potentials.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 5figures

entry.title: Results of the Hydrodynamics Approach to Heavy Ion Collisions
entry.summary: Recent hydrodynamical calculations for Au+Au collisions at sqrt(s) = 130 AGeV energy are reviewed, and the initial conditions of hydrodynamical evolution necessary to reproduce experimental data are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 7 figures, talk at Quark Matter '02, Nantes, France, July 2002

entry.title: Generalized Partial Dynamical Symmetries in Nuclear Spectroscopy
entry.summary: Explicit forms of IBM Hamiltonians with a generalized partial dynamical O(6) symmetry are presented and compared with empirical data in $^{162}$Dy.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 2 figures, Proc. Int. Conf. on Nuclear Structure "Mapping the Triangle", May 22-25, 2002,Wyoming, USA

entry.title: Some remarks on the statistical model of heavy ion collisions
entry.summary: This contribution is an attempt to assess what can be learned from the remarkable success of the statistical model in describing ratios of particle abundances in ultra-relativistic heavy ion collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings, Quark Matter 2002, Nantes, France

entry.title: Structure functions and parton distributions
entry.summary: In this talk, I review the status of theoretical understanding of nuclear structure functions and parton distributions and discuss the constraints on nuclear parton distributions from existing data and the global QCD analysis.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, 10 pages, to appear in the proceedings of QM2002

entry.title: Order generated by random many-body dynamics
entry.summary: New features related to collective properties generated in the systems driven by random dynamics are observed and their implications for further understanding of interplay between coherence and chaos are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: Effective Field Theory for Nuclear Physics
entry.summary: I review the current status of the application of effective field theory to nuclear physics, and its present implications for nuclear astrophysics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 9 figures, latex. Talk at PaNic02, September 30-October 4, 2002, Osaka, Japan

entry.title: The Contribution of the Quark Condensate to the pi N Sigma Term
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn at the request of one of the authors.

entry.title: Pseudoscalar Mesons in Nuclear Medium
entry.summary: The behavior of pseudoscalar mesons in nuclear medium is reviewed with an emphasis on the possibility of their Bose-Einstein condensation in dense matter. In particular pion condensation is reexamined in detail, stimulated by recent theoretical and observational developments.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at the Workshop "MEDIUM02", Kyushu, Oct.25 - 26, 2002

entry.title: Exploring Baryon Chiral Multiplets
entry.summary: The full QCD chiral symmetry algebra has predictive consequences at low energies. I discuss the ground-state chiral multiplet involving the light baryons and emphasize the special role of the Roper resonance.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages. Invited plenary talk at NSTAR 2002, Pittsburgh, PA, 9-12 October 2002

entry.title: Three particle states and t-exchanges
entry.summary: The multiple particle final states in modern data from $4 \pi$ detector experiments offer a wealth of information about higher hadronic resonances and hadron interactions. However, it requires careful analysis to extract model independent results from those data.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 figure, Proceedings of Nstar, Pittsburgh, Oct. 2002

entry.title: Mass Shifts through Re-scattering
entry.summary: In this note we present a model that can produce a mass shift in a resonance due to interference between a scattering amplitude and that amplitude having rescattering through the resonance.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages

entry.title: Searching for space-time asymmetries in particle production
entry.summary: The possibilities of unlike particle correlations for a study of the space-time asymmetries in particle production, including the sequence of particle emission, are demonstrated.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proc. 8th Int. Workshop on Multiparticle production, Correlations and Fluctuations '98, Matrahaza, Hungary, June 14-21, 1998, p. 148-155

entry.title: Kinematical classification of two-pion production on the nucleon
entry.summary: We give a full kinematical classification of all the tree-level two-pion photoproduction processes on the nucleon, which consists of seventeen diagrams. It suggests a method of analysis of two-pion data with little model bias.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 10 figures (with 96 Dalitz plots)

entry.title: Nuclear Astrophysics in Rare Isotope Facilities
entry.summary: I discuss a few of the recent developments in nuclear reactions at very low energies with emphasis on the role of radioactive beam facilities.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings 19th Winter Workshop on Nuclear Dynamics, Breckenridge, Colorado, USA, February 8-15, 2003

entry.title: Hydrodynamical description of collective flow
entry.summary: I review how hydrodynamical flow is related to the observed flow in ultrarelativistic heavy ion collisions and how initial conditions, equation of state and freeze-out temperature affect flow in hydrodynamical models.
entry.arxiv:comment: Review for "Quark-Gluon Plasma 3", eds. R.C. Hwa and X.-N. Wang, World Scientific, Singapore. 36 pages. 15 figures

entry.title: Equilibrium in Heavy Ion Collisions
entry.summary: We discuss the question of equilibriation in heavy ion collisions and how it can be addressed in experiment
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings 19th Winter Workshop on Nuclear Dynamics, Breckenridge, Co, 2003

entry.title: "Modified" BCS theory at finite temperature and its flaws
entry.summary: Drawbacks of a recently suggested modified BCS theory at finite temperature in [Phys. Rev. C {\bf 67}, 014304 (2003)] are discussed. We conclude that the thermal behavior of the pairing correlations is not under control within this model.

entry.title: Nuclear Physics from QCD
entry.summary: Recent attempts to make direct contact between QCD and simple nuclear systems are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pp, 9 figs, plenary talk at 17th International IUPAP Conference on Few-body Problems in Physics, June 5-10, 2003, Durham, North Carolina, USA

entry.title: Atomic Nucleus as a Laboratory for Fundamental Processes
entry.summary: Concluding remarks about the scientific contents of the XXVIII Mazurian Lakes Conference on Physics are presented.

entry.title: Multichannel processes in relativistic Coulomb excitation mediated by a quantized electromagnetic field
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn because it draws incorrect conclusions from the results of its calculations.

entry.title: Comment on "Unmasking the nuclear equation of state"
entry.summary: Referring to a recently published paper [J. Piekarewicz, Phys. Rev. C 69, 041301 (2004)], we point out that Dirac-Brueckner-Hartree-Fock calculations of the symmetry energy predict values of the neutron skin of heavy nuclei which are remarkably consistent with those from a recent ``best-fit'' analysis.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, comment

entry.title: Three-pair final-state interaction in the pp->ppηreaction close to threshold
entry.summary: We present a three-body formalism describing final-state interaction effects. The three-body enhancement factor is derived by expanding the complete three-particle wave function in hyperspherical harmonics.

entry.title: Distance to the drip lines
entry.summary: It can be found that with the adequate measure, the beta stability line is equidistant from neutron and proton drip lines. We explore this fact and its predictive potentiality in the simplest case, the classic liquid drop formula.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages

entry.title: Testing Non-local Nucleon-Nucleon Interactions in the Four-Nucleon Systems
entry.summary: The Faddeev-Yakubovski equations are solved in configuration space for the $% \alpha$-particle and n-$^3$H continuum states. We test the ability of nonlocal nucleon-nucleon interaction models to describe 3N and 4N systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 6 figures

entry.title: The Interest in Kaonic-Deuterium Atoms
entry.summary: K meson-deuteron scattering lengths, atomic level shifts and widths are calculated. These quantities depend on controversial kaon-nucleon scattering amplitudes extrapolated by few MeV below the $KN$ threshold. Experimental consequences of several $KN$ interaction models are studied.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages

entry.title: Effective Operator Treatment of the Lipkin Model
entry.summary: We analyze the Lipkin Model using effective operator techniques. We present both analytical and numerical results for effective Hamiltonians. The accuracy of the cluster approximation is investigated.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Phys.Rev.C

entry.title: Suspicion on Engrafting HBT From Astronomy to Heavy Ion Collision
entry.summary: HBT method in astronomy and heavy ion collision is contrasted in present article.Some differences are found and validity of using HBT in heavy ion collision is suspected.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 figures

entry.title: Mononuclear caloric curve in a mean field model
entry.summary: A mean field model is used to investigate if a plateau in caloric curve can be reached in mononuclear configuration. In the model the configuration will break up into many pieces as the plateau is approached.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages,2 figures

entry.title: On the nuclear states of K^- mesons
entry.summary: The KNNN bound states recently discovered at KEK are studied. It is shown that the Lambda(1405) and Sigma(1385) resonant states coupled to the KN system may generate an attraction strong enough to form such bound states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages

entry.title: Evidence for psi' Regeneration in Heavy Ion Collisions
entry.summary: The production of the psi' meson in Pb+Pb collisions at CERN SPS is analyzed. It provides an evidence for charmonium regeneration via charm quark-antiquark coalescence at hadronization.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page, 1 figure, LaTeX2e

entry.title: Formal and Physical R-matrix parameters
entry.summary: Notes from 11 October 2004 lecture presented at the Joint Institute for Nuclear Astrophysics R-Matrix School at Notre Dame University.
entry.arxiv:comment: Notes from 11 October 2004 lecture presented at the Joint Institute for Nuclear Astrophysics R-Matrix School at Notre Dame University (7 pages)

entry.title: Comment on "Constraints on proton structure from precision atomic physics measurements"
entry.summary: We strongly disagree with the procedure used in a recent paper to extract the Zemach moment for hydrogen.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page, 2 figures, revtex - submitted to Physical Review Letters

entry.title: Backbending Effect in Deformed e-e Nuclei
entry.summary: An extension of the previously proposed Variable Moment of Inertia with Softness model VMIS has been applied to describe successfully the effect of backbending in some deformed e-e nuclei. The model shows good results in the rare earth and actinide regions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 1 figure (1x22), 2 tables (2x1&1x1)

entry.title: An Approach To Potential Scattering
entry.summary: Recently developed time-independent bound-state perturbation theory is extended to treat the scattering domain. The changes in the partial wave phase shifts are derived explicitly and the results are compared with those of other methods.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, no figures

entry.title: Subthreshold $ππ$ interference in three-particle final states
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn because the issues raised have been resolved by Cabibbo and Isidori, hep-ph/0502130.

entry.title: Pi-meson as the quanta of non-newtonian hadronic fluid
entry.summary: It occurs that when we attempt to melt the nucleon in order to obtain the free quark gas, or QGP fluid the mass of the heat quantum (heaton) is equal to the pi-meson mass. Key words: Heat quanta; Quantum heat transport; Quantum diffusion coefficient.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages

entry.title: Symmetric Density Functionals
entry.summary: Variations in distinct restricted spaces of wave functions generate distinct density functionals. In particular, angular momentum projected Slater determinants define a new density functional, compatible simultaneously with angular momentum quantum number and mean field descriptions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: Improving the Feshbach-Rubinow approximation
entry.summary: The binding energy of three identical bosons is estimated by coupled differential equations which generalise the Feshbach--Rubinow approximation. This method turns out to be rather efficient, especially in the limit of vanishing binding.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, Plain TeX

entry.title: More on nucleon-nucleon cross sections in symmetric and asymmetric matter
entry.summary: Following a recent work, we present numerical results for total two-nucleon effective cross sections in isospin symmetric and asymmetric matter. The present calculations include the additional effect of Pauli blocking of the final states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, no figures, 5 tables

entry.title: Dynamic nature at the QCD Critical End Point
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to inadequate arguments.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: Isotropization by QCD Plasma Instabilities
entry.summary: Numerical solutions of the Wong-Yang-Mills equations with anisotropic particle momentum distributions are presented. Their isotropization by collective effects due to the classical Yang-Mills field is shown.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 4 figures, contribution to the Quark Matter 2005 proceedings

entry.title: Correlation femtoscopy
entry.summary: The basics of correlation femtoscopy, recent results from femtoscopy in relativistic heavy ion collisions and their consequences are shortly reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, plenary review talk at Quark Matter 2005, 2 references added

entry.title: Five lectures on effective field theory
entry.summary: Lectures delivered at the 17th National Nuclear Physics Summer School 2005, Berkeley, CA, June 6-17, 2005.
entry.arxiv:comment: 79 pages, 15 figures

entry.title: Towards exact variational Monte-Carlo calculations in light nuclei
entry.summary: This paper is being withdrawn by the authors in order to correct some errors and also to introduce improved theoretical techniques.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, one figure, two tables

entry.title: Is HBT really puzzling?
entry.summary: Two-particle correlations from RHIC have provided a surprising snapshot of the final state at RHIC. In this talk I discuss the nature of the HBT puzzle and attempt to delineate several factors which might ultimately resolve the issue.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings for WPCF, Kromeriz, Czech Republic, August 2005

entry.title: Mass generation in coalescence - effects on hadron spectra
entry.summary: Different scenarios for the creation of constituent mass in the hadron formation process are discussed. Effects of these may be observable in hadron momentum spectra.

entry.title: Nuclei from QCD : Strategy, Challenges and Status
entry.summary: I describe progress that is being made toward calculating the properties and interactions of nuclei from QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 10 figs. Contribution to Panic05, Sante Fe, New Mexico, October 2005

entry.title: Nuclear models and neutrino cross sections
entry.summary: Merits and faults of the effective theory Random Phase Approximations are discussed in the perspective of its use in the prediction of neutrino-nucleus cross sections.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contibution to NuInt05, 4th International workshop on neutrino-nucleus interaction in the few GeV region, Sept. 26 - 29 2005, Okayama, Japan

entry.title: Microscopic theory of the two-proton radioactivity
entry.summary: We formulate theory of the two-proton radioactivity based on the real-energy continuum shell model. This microscopic approach is applied to describe the two-proton decay of the $1^-_2$ state in $^{18}$Ne.

entry.title: Superscaling in electron- and neutrino-nucleus scattering
entry.summary: The superscaling properties of electron scattering data are used to extract model-independent predictions for neutrino-nucleus cross sections.

entry.title: Magic Numbers from New Systematics
entry.summary: A new systematics from the separation energy of deuteron is used to examine the magicity of stable as well as nuclei towards dripline.

entry.title: Origins of Viscosity in Relativistic Heavy Ion Collisons
entry.summary: Withdrawn by author. This paper was mistakenly submitted twice (See nucl-th/0604008)
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdrawn by author. This paper was mistakenly submitted twice (See nucl-th/0604008)

entry.title: Patches to UrQMD Model Code
entry.summary: Patches to the code of the Ultra-relativisic Quantum Molecular Dynamics model (UrQMD version 1.3) are described. They improve the code operation. The most important one is done for the file ANNDEC.F.

entry.title: Applications of Continuum Shell Model
entry.summary: The nuclear many-body problem at the limits of stability is considered in the framework of the Continuum Shell Model that allows a unified description of intrinsic structure and reactions. Technical details behind the method are highlighted and practical applications combining the reaction and structure pictures are presented.

entry.title: Heavy-ion interaction potential deduced from density-constrained TDHF calculation
entry.summary: We present a new method for calculating the heavy-ion interaction potential from a density-constrained time-dependent Hartree-Fock calculation.

entry.summary: I review current status of lattice QCD calculations of the deconfining transition at finite temperature and quarkonia spectral functions.

entry.title: Toy model of the Nucleon - Nucleon potential
entry.summary: We start from a system of six interacting constituent quarks and examine how the picture of two nucleons can change when substructure of the nucleons are taken into account.

entry.title: Kinematic Rotations of N-particle Hyperspherical Basis
entry.summary: The kinematical rotations of N-partical Hyperspherical basis are considered. The recurrence relation method of determination of transformation coefficients for arbitrary N-values is demonstrated.

entry.title: Nuclear Astrophysics: CIPANP 2006

Topics selected include solar neutrinos, supernovae (the explosion and associated nucleosynthesis), laboratory astrophysics, and neutron star structure.

entry.title: Few Body Reserch - Summary

entry.summary: We present first calculations for Compton scattering on $^3$He. The objective of the calculation is an extraction of the neutron polarizabilities.

entry.title: Study of nucleon resonances with electromagnetic interactions
entry.summary: Recent developments in using electromagnetic meson production reactions to study the structure of nucleon resonances are reviewed. Possible future works are discussed.

entry.title: Large two-pion-exchange contributions to the $pp\to ppπ^0$ reaction
entry.summary: The large two-pion exchange amplitudes are calculated in HB$\chi$PT and their net contribution to the reaction cross section is large.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, to appear in proceedings of Chiral Dynamics 2006

entry.title: Heavy ion collisions in the used nucleon model
entry.summary: It is shown that recently proposed by R.J. Glauber the used nucleon model combined with the assumption that the nucleon consists of two constituents (a quark and a diquark) describes well the PHOBOS data on particle production at midrapidity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: Electromagnetic Dissociation and Space Radiation
entry.summary: Relativistic nucleus-nucleus reactions occur mainly through the Strong or Electromagnetic (EM) interactions. Transport codes often neglect the latter. This work shows the importance of including EM interactions for space radiation applications.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages

entry.title: Transition Matrix Elements for Pion Photoproduction
entry.summary: We have obtained the transition matrix elements for pion photoproduction by considering the number of gamma matrices involved. The approach based on the most general conditions of gauge invariance, current conservation and transversality. The approach is fairly consistent with literatures.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 1 Figure

entry.title: The one-particle momentum transfer in point-form spectator approximation
entry.summary: The one-particle momentum transfer operator is derived in point-form spectator approximation for $NN$ system. General expression is applied to elastic electron-deuteron scattering and to deuteron photodisintegration.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, typos

entry.title: Nuclear forces from chiral effective field theory
entry.summary: In this lecture series, I present the recent progress in our understanding of nuclear forces in terms of chiral effective field theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 54 pages, 12 figures; lectures presented at the DAE-BRNS workshop on physics and astrophysics of hadrons and hadronic matter, Visva Bharati University, Santiniketan, West Begal, India, November 2006

entry.title: Model independent Breit-Wigner parameters of nucleon resonances S11(1535), S11(1650) and P11(1710)
entry.summary: Estimates of Breit-Wigner parameters of nucleon resonances were obtained by phenomenological analysis of eta meson photoproduction on protons performed completely by statistical procedures without appealing to theoretical models
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 2 tables

entry.title: Comment on "Influence of protons on the capture of electrons by 7Be in the Sun"
entry.summary: This paper suffers from conceptual difficulties and unjustified approximations that render its conclusions dubious.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to Physical Review C

entry.title: The centrality dependence of elliptic flow at LHC
entry.summary: We present predictions for the centrality dependence of elliptic flow at mid-rapidity in Pb-Pb collisions at the LHC.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of the CERN Workshop "Heavy Ion Collisions at the LHC: Last Call for Predictions",

entry.title: Compressibility and equation of state of finite nuclei
entry.summary: We present a new approach for calculating the nuclear equation of state and compressibility for finite nuclei using the density-constrained Hartree-Fock method.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: On the nuclear reactions with participation of near-threshold baryon resonances
entry.summary: The main features of nuclear reactions with participation of baryon resonances ($\Delta$(1232), S(1535) and $\Lambda$(1405)), which are interpreted as a manifestation of the bound states of nucleus and corresponding meson are discussed.

entry.title: Laboratory Density Functionals
entry.summary: We compare several definitions of the density of a self-bound system, such as a nucleus, in relation with its center-of-mass zero-point motion. A trivial deconvolution relates the internal density to the density defined in the laboratory frame. This result is useful for the practical definition of density functionals.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages

entry.title: Statistical hadronization model predictions for charmed hadrons at LHC
entry.summary: We present predictions of the statistical hadronization model for charmed hadrons production in Pb+Pb collisions at LHC.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, 2 figues; presented in the CERN workshop "Heavy Ion Collisions at the LHC: Last Call for Predictions"

entry.title: Thermal model predictions of hadron ratios at LHC
entry.summary: We present predictions of the thermal model for hadron ratios in central Pb+Pb collisions at LHC.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages; presented in the CERN workshop "Heavy Ion Collisions at the LHC: Last Call for Predictions"

entry.title: Progress and challenges in the theory of nuclei
entry.summary: Nuclear theory today aims for a comprehensive theoretical framework that can describe all nuclei. I discuss recent progress in this pursuit and the associated challenges as we move forward.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, INPC 2007 proceedings

entry.title: The Extending for Composite Skyrme Model
entry.summary: In this paper, we have extended the composite Skyrme model proposed by H. Y. Cheung, F. Gursey to some respects of theoretical physics such as supersymmetry, gravitation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: Chiral dynamics of few-nucleon systems
entry.summary: I discuss some recent developments in chiral effective field theory for few-nucleon systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 6 figures, invited talk, International Nuclear Physics Conference (INPC 2007), Tokyo, Japan, June 3-8, 2007

entry.title: Coulomb interactions within Halo Effective Field Theory
entry.summary: I present preliminary results of effective field theory applied to nuclear cluster systems, where Coulomb interactions play a significant role.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at the 20th European Conference on Few-Body Problems in Physics, Pisa, Italy, September 10-14, 2007

entry.title: On The Leptons Masses
entry.summary: In this paper we present a connection between the results obtained from a semiclassical study of a relativistic, two-body system, and the leptons masses. Some possible consequences are also discussed.

entry.title: Reply to Comment on ``Ab Initio Study of 40-Ca with an Importance Truncated No-Core Shell Model''
entry.summary: We respond to Comment on our recent letter (Phys.Rev.Lett.99:092501,2007) by Dean et al (arXiv:0709.0449).
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages

entry.title: Scalar Nature of the Nuclear Density Functional
entry.summary: Because of the rotational invariance of the nuclear Hamiltonian, there exists a density functional for nuclei that depends only on two scalar densities. Practical calculations boil down to radial, one-dimensional ones.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages

entry.title: Nuclear Constraints on the Weak Nucleon-Nucleon Interaction
entry.summary: I discuss the current status of efforts to constrain the strangeness-conserving weak hadronic interaction, which can be isolated in nuclear systems because of the associated parity violation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Hot QCD equation of state and quark-gluon plasma-- finite quark chemical potential
entry.summary: withdrawn due to detection of numerical errors
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: Analytical Calculation of the Neutrons Spectrum for Direct Measurement of N-N Scattering at Pulsed Reactor Yaguar
entry.summary: Analytical calculation of a single neutron detector counts per YAGUAR reactor pulse is presented and comparison with coincidence scheme is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: The "ab initio" approach to the nuclear equation of state: review and discussion
entry.summary: We review the main components of our microscopic model of nuclear matter, which we have recently extended to incorporate isospin asymmetry. Some frequently discussed issues concerning nuclear many-body approaches are revisited and critically analysed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: Chaos assisted decay of $^{180}Ta^m$
entry.summary: The decay of the $J=9^-$ isomeric state in $^{180}Ta$ is described in a model based on the phenomenon of chaos assisted tunneling. The model attempts to explain the enhanced decay of the isomeric state when irradiated by gamma-rays or subjected to Coulomb excitations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages PDF

entry.title: Pseudospin symmetry and effective field theory
entry.summary: Pseudopsin has been shown to be approximately conserved in nuclei. We investigate whether or not there is an advantage in using the pseudospin operators as well as the spin operators in the description of the nucleon-nucleon interaction. We conclude that, indeed, there is an advantage.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages

entry.title: Neutrino Astrophysics
entry.summary: I review the current status of neutrino astrophysics, including solar neutrinos; atmospheric neutrinos; neutrino mass and oscillations; supernova neutrinos; neutrino nucleosynthesis (Big Bang nucleosynthesis, the neutrino process, the r-process); neutrino cooling and red giants; and high energy neutrino astronomy.
entry.arxiv:comment: 37 pages, 15 figures; presentation at an introductory level

entry.title: Charged pions multiplicities at the NA49 energy
entry.summary: The wounded quark-diquark model predictions for charged pions multiplicities in PbPb and pPb collisions in the central rapidity region at sqrt(s)=17.3 GeV c.m. energy are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Padé expansion and nucleon-nucleon scattering in coupled channels
entry.summary: We extend our Pad\'e-aided analysis of the nonperturbative renormalization of nucleon-nucleon scattering to the case of coupled channels.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 6 figures, 1 table

entry.title: Viscosity at RHIC: Theory and Practice
entry.summary: Hydrodynamic behavior and the associated discussions of viscosity at RHIC has inspired a r enaissance in modeling viscous hydrodynamics. An explanation of Israel-Stewart hydrodynamics is presented here, with an emphasis on the tangible benefits compared to Navier Stokes.
entry.arxiv:comment: proceedings to 24th Winter Workshop on Nuclear Dynamics, South Padre Island, Texas, April 2008

entry.title: A self-confined Fermi-gas model for nuclear collective motion
entry.summary: The main result of this study consists in working out a microscopic description of collective motion in hot nuclei, allowing to express the parameters of a phenomenological collective model in terms of nucleonic quantities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 40 pages, 5 fugures, to be submitted to Nucl. Phys. A

entry.title: Features of exceptional points and the continuum spectroscopy
entry.summary: We discuss observable features of exceptional points and the resonance spectroscopy of $^{16}$Ne using the Shell Model Embedded in the Continuum.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 4 figures Zakopane Conference on Nuclear Physics, September 1-7, 2008, Zakopane, Poland

entry.title: The Quest for the Nuclear Equation of State
entry.summary: The present status of the efforts to determine the nuclear equation of state from results of heavy ion reactions and from astrophysical observations is reviewed

entry.title: Many Body Theory for Quartets, Trions, and Pairs in Low Density Multi-Component Fermi-Systems
entry.summary: A selfconsistent many body approach for the description of gases with quartets, trions, and pairs is presented. Applications to 3D Fermi systems at low density are discussed.

entry.title: Structure of many-body continuum states in the proximity of exceptional points
entry.summary: We demonstrate existence of exceptional points in many-body scattering continuum of atomic nucleus and discuss their salient effects on the example of one-nucleon spectroscopic factors.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Nuclear Matter and Nuclear Dynamics
entry.summary: Highlights on the recent research activity, carried out by the Italian Community involved in the "Nuclear Matter and Nuclear Dynamics" field, will be presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of the 12th Conference on Problems in Theoretical Nuclear Physics, to appear in Journal of Physics, Conference Series

entry.title: Directed flow - a sensitive probe of the early flow in ultrarelativistic heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, see P. Bozek and I. Wyskiel, arXiv: 1002.4999 [nucl-th]

entry.title: On the asymptotic methods for nuclear collective models
entry.summary: Contractions of orthogonal groups to Euclidean groups are applied to analytic descriptions of nuclear quantum phase transitions. The semiclassical asymptotic of multipole collective Hamiltonians are also investigated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages

entry.title: Anomalous delta-type electric and magnetic two-nucleon interactions
entry.summary: Anomalous delta-type interactions, of both electric and magnetic nature, are introduced between the overlapping peripheral structures of the nucleons, which may explain the spin-triplet deuteron state and the absence of other nucleon-nucleon bound states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, no figures

entry.title: Low-energy QCD and hadronic structure
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 14 figures, Proc. Int. Conf. on Particles and Nuclei (PANIC08), Nucl. Phys. A (in print)

entry.title: Recent progress in lattice QCD at finite temperature
entry.summary: I review recent progress in finite temperature lattice calculations, including the study of the nature of the deconfinement transition in QCD, equation of state, screening of static quarks and meson spectral functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at 25th Winter workshop on nuclear dynamics, Feb. 1-8, 2009. Big Sky Montana, 8 pages LaTeX

entry.title: The QCD confinement transition: hadron formation
entry.summary: We review the foundations and the applications of the statistical and the quark recombination model as hadronization models.
entry.arxiv:comment: 45 pages, 16 figures, accepted for publication in Landolt-Boernstein Volume 1-23A

entry.title: The Multifaceted Skyrmion
entry.summary: This submission has been withdrawn because it is an advertisement, which is not permitted.
entry.arxiv:comment: This submission has been withdrawn by arXiv admins [2009-07-14]

entry.title: Photoproduction of strangeness
entry.summary: the photoproduction of the lambda^0 and K^+ from circularly polarized photons on protons is discussed. Experiments and past theories are reviewed. We present a simple quark model, the results of which we compare to experiments
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 10 figures

entry.title: Landau hydrodynamic solution for non-central heavy ion collisions
entry.summary: The manuscript presents generalization of the Landau hydrodynamic solution for multiparticle production applied for non-central relativistic heavy ion collisions.
