Obtained solution enables to calculate anisotropy parameter $v_2$ for different rapidities with respect to the initial conditions for hydrodynamics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages 1 figure

entry.title: Antikaon interactions with nucleons and nuclei
entry.summary: This report summarizes our understanding of antikaon-nucleon interactions and reviews the present theoretical situation in the quest for quasibound antikaon-nuclear systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 5 figures, Proceedings Int. Conf. on Hypernuclear and Strange Particle Physics, Sept. 14-18, 2009, Tokai, Japan

entry.title: Quantum Condensates in Nuclear Matter: Problems
entry.summary: In connection with the contribution "Quantum Condensates in Nuclear Matter" some problems are given to become more familiar with the techniques of many-particle physics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: Dilaton and gluon condensate in a nucleon medium
entry.summary: The gluon condensate as a function of temperature and baryon density in a nucleon medium is obtained from an effective dilaton Lagrangian. It is shown that, at a normal nuclear density of nucleons, n_0 = 0.17 fm^{-3} the gluon condensate decreases by about 10%.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages

entry.title: A Simple Quark Model for γp -> K^+ Λ^0
entry.summary: The photoproduction of the \Lambda^0 and K^+ from circularly polarized photons on protons is discussed in a simple quark model; we compare the result to experiments.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 10 figures

entry.title: Qualitative aspects of the models of $n\bar{n}$ transition in nuclei
entry.summary: We briefly outline the present state of the $n\bar{n}$ transition problem and compare two alternative models.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: Effective field theory and electro-weak processes
entry.summary: Heavy baryon chiral perturbation theory is applied to one- and two nucleon processes.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk at the conference on "Achievements and New Directions in Subatomic Physics: Workshop in Honour of Tony Thomas' 60th Birthday", 15-19 February 2010

entry.title: Color Transparency at COMPASS energies
entry.summary: Pionic quasielastic knockout of protons from nuclei at 200 GeV show very large effects of color transparency as -t increases from 0 to several GeV^2. Similar effects are expected for quasielastic photoproduction of vector mesons.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: A few brief comments to arXiv:1005.3315 and arXiv:1005.3321
entry.summary: It is discussed the inconsistency of the so-called ladder-rainbow truncation scheme to QCD in the framework of the Dyson-Schwinger equation for the quark propagator and the Bethe-Salpeter equation for the bound state of mesons.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page, no tables and figures

entry.title: Comments to the paper "Effect of Coulomb forces on the Position of the Pole in the Scattering Amplitude and on Its Resudue" published in Phys.At.Nuclei, {\bf 73} (2010) 757
entry.summary: Certain comments on the paper of Yu.V. Orlov, B. F. Irgaziev and L. I. Nikitina published in Phys.At.Nuclei, {\bf 73} (2010) 757 are made.

entry.title: Single-energy amplitudes for pion photoproduction in the first resonance region
entry.summary: We consider multipole amplitudes for low-energy pion photoproduction, constructed with minimal model dependence, at single energies. Comparisons with fits to the full resonance region are made. Explanations are suggested for the discrepancies and further experiments are motivated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Neutrino Mean Free Path in Neutron Star
entry.summary: Have been calculated the differential cross section and mean free path of neutrino of neutrino interaction in dense matter.
entry.arxiv:comment: 78 pages, 17 figures, master thesis (In Indonesia language)

entry.title: Multi-Hyper-Nuclei Production in Anti-Proton Induced Reactions within a Microscopic Transport Approach
entry.summary: we do not pulish this
entry.arxiv:comment: Co-authors names removed due to authorship dispute [2010-10-21 arXiv admin]

entry.title: The six-nucleon Yakubovsky equations for 6He
entry.summary: The six-nucleon problem for the bound state is formulated in the Yakubovsky scheme. Hints for a numerical implementation are provided.
entry.arxiv:comment: 25 pages, 0 figures

entry.title: Hadronic Interactions with lattice QCD
entry.summary: I describe recent progress toward calculating hadronic interactions with Lattice QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 7 figures Talk presented on behalf of the NPLQCD Collaboration at MENU 2010, May 31-June 4, 2010. College of William and Mary, Williamsburg, Virginia, USA

entry.title: Cherenkov Radiation of Gluon Currents
entry.summary: Full quantum calculation of the in-medium Cherenkov gluon emission by gluon current in transparent media without dispersion is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: To be published in the proceedings of QUARKS 2010

entry.title: Chiral symmetry, nuclear forces and all that
entry.summary: These are personal recollections of how Gerry Brown's work and thinking influenced the development of the chiral effective Lagrangian based theory of nuclear forces.
entry.arxiv:comment: Prepared for the Festschrift for Gerry Brown

entry.title: Interesting,Surprising and Perhaps Amusing Results in Nuclear Physics Calculations Over the the Years
entry.summary: We have compiled some sections of works by L. Zamick and collaborators which we hope will be of interest to the reader.

entry.title: The largest negative value of the spin operator
entry.summary: We find the largest negative value of the expectation of the spin operator for a many nucleon system.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn and replaced by 1103.5563

entry.title: Collective flow and balance energy in asymmetric heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: Collective flow and balance energy in asymmetric heavy-ion collisions
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Symposium on Nuclear Physics, DAE, BARC, Mumbai, India, Dec 8-12 (2009) Volume 54 (2009) page 450

entry.title: Influence of the Range of Interaction on the Stability of the Nucleus propagating with Momentum Dependent Interactions
entry.summary: Influence of the Range of Interaction on the Stability of the Nucleus propagating with Momentum Dependent Interactions.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: 3rd International Conference on Frontiers in Nuclear Structure, Astrophysics and Reactions, 23-27 August 2010, Rhodos, Greece

entry.title: Study of formation of stable fragments in central heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: We study the stability of fragments using microscopic binding energy criteria in heavy-ion collisions.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International symposium on Nuclear Physics, DAE, BITS, Pilani, India, Dec. 19-24 (2010), Volume 55, page 514

entry.title: Quantum Amplification on Molecular-Nuclear Transitions
entry.summary: Molecular-nuclear transitions induced by external radiation are considered in this report, and new mechanism of quantum amplification based on this process is proposed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages

entry.title: Projected Thermal Hartree-Fock-Bogoliubov approximation in a canonical ensemble
entry.summary: The Thermal Hartree-Fock-Bogoliubov approximation with reprojection to good quantum numbers is analyzed in a canonical ensemble. Simple recipes are given for the evaluation of traces, gradients and expectation values in the canonical ensemble.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages

entry.title: The low energy frontier: What is exciting about physics below the top RHIC energy
entry.summary: These proceedings summarize my plenary talk at Quark Matter 2011 with a focus on the future perspectives of the low energy programs at RHIC, FAIR, NICA and CERN.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of Quark Matter 2011

entry.title: Effect of isospin degree of freedom on the counterbalancing of collective transverse in-plane flow
entry.summary: Here we aim to understand the effect of isospin dependence of cross section and Coulomb repulsion on the counterbalancing of collective flow
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 2 figs, DAE BRNS Symposium on Nuclear Physics Dec 26-30, (2011), Visakhapatnam A.P. INDIA

entry.title: Pb-Radioactivity in superheavy elements
entry.summary: The Pb-radioactivity in the superheavy mass region is studied within the frame work of PCM model,the calculation of Pb-Radioactivity looks favorably for the cluster decay studies in superheavy mass region as in the heavy mass region.

entry.title: Distribution of neutron resonance widths
entry.summary: Recent data on neutron resonance widths indicate disagreement with the Porter-Thomas distribution (PTD). I discuss the theoretical arguments for the PTD, possible theoretical modifications, and I summarize the experimantal evidence.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 3 figures, conference report

entry.title: Onset of multifragmentation and vaporization in Au-Au collisions
entry.summary: Onset of multifragmentation and vaporization in Au-Au collisions
entry.arxiv:comment: DAE Symposium on Nuclear Physics, December 26-30, 2011, Department of Nuclear Physics, Andhra University, Visakhapatnam, A.P., India

entry.title: Mass asymmetry effects on geometry of vanishing flow
entry.summary: Mass asymmetry effects on geometry of vanishing flow.
entry.arxiv:comment: DAE Symposium on Nuclear Physics, December 26-30, 2011, Department of Nuclear Physics, Andhra University, Visakhapatnam, A.P., India

entry.title: Study of stability of nuclei, flow and multifragmentation in heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: Study of stability of nuclei, flow and multifragmentation in heavy-ion collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: DAE Symposium on Nuclear Physics, December 26-30, 2011, Department of Nuclear Physics, Andhra University, Visakhapatnam, A.P., India

entry.title: Nuclear dynamics of mass asymmetric systems at balance energy
entry.summary: Nuclear dynamics of mass asymmetric systems at balance energy.
entry.arxiv:comment: DAE Symposium on Nuclear Physics, December 26-30, 2011, Department of Nuclear Physics, Andhra University, Visakhapatnam, A.P., India

entry.title: Transport coefficients of the second order hydrodynamics and the applicability of hydrodynamic model
entry.summary: Based on the Nakajima-Zubarev type nonequilibrium density operator, we derive microscopic formulae of the transport coefficients in the second order hydrodynamics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4pages, Contributed paper for the XLI International Symposium on Multiparticle Dynamics (ISMD2011)

entry.title: Strangeness and the Quark-Gluon Plasma: Thirty Years of Discovery
entry.summary: I review some aspects of the role of strange quarks in hot QCD matter and as probes of quark deconfinement at high temperature.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk presented at SQM2011, Krakow (Poland), September 18-24, 2011
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Acta Physica Polonica B vol. 43 (2012) page 761

entry.title: Reviving old, almost lost knowledge on T and K matrix poles and a link to the contemporary QCD spectrum
entry.summary: The old knowledge about interrelation among T-matrix, K-matrix and bare poles is summarized and put into modern perspective.

entry.title: Monitoring parton equilibration in heavy ion collisions via dilepton polarization
entry.summary: In this note we discuss how angular distribution of the dileptons produced in heavy ion collisions at RHIC/LHC energies can provide an information about a degree of local equilibration of the quark-gluon plasma produced at different invariant mass regions.

entry.title: Single-Particle Distributions in Multi-Chain Model with successive collision for High-Energy Nucleus-Nucleus collisions
entry.summary: High-energy nucleus-nucleus collisions are studied in multi-chain model with successive collision. Analytic forms for single-particle distribution are derived.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages,2 figures

entry.title: V2 Scaling in PbPb Collisions at 2.76 TeV
entry.summary: We investigate scaling properties of the elliptical flow parameter v_{2} in PbPb Collisions at 2.76 TeV within a recently introduced new theoretical scheme which accounts for hydrodynamically expanding bulk matter, jets, and the interaction between the two.

entry.title: Tensor Interaction in SkHF theory and its influence on evolution of nuclear shells
entry.summary: Using SKP force parameters the evolution of nuclear shells has been studied in Hartree-Fock calculations with the inclusion of tensor interaction.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, 10 figures

entry.title: Migdal and his theory in Jülich
entry.summary: We review the application of Migdal's "Theory of Finite Fermi System" to the structure of deformed nuclei, approaches beyond the conventional linear response, and microscopic calculations of the Migdal-parameters.
entry.arxiv:comment: 28 pages, 12 figures

entry.title: Streched Magnetic Moments
entry.summary: We note that for a system of 2 nucleons in a stretched case (J=J1+J2) the magnetic moment of the combined system is the sum of the magnetic moments of the 2 constituents. We compile other simple formulas.

entry.title: Hydrodynamics for relativistic heavy ion collisions
entry.summary: Simulations of the viscous hydrodynamic model for relativistic heavy-ion collisions at RHIC and LHC energies are presented. Results for spectra, femtoscopy radii, and transverse momentum fluctuations are favorably compared to the experimental data. Effects of the local charge conservation on correlation observables are also studied.

entry.title: Corrections to nuclear energies and radii in finite oscillator spaces
entry.summary: We derive corrections to the ground-state energies and radii of atomic nuclei that result from the limitations of finite oscillator spaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 6 figures

entry.title: No Pain, No Gain: Hard Probes of the Quark-Gluon Plasma Coming of Age
entry.summary: This lecture presents a concise review of the current status of hard QCD and electromagnetic processes as probes of the quark-gluon plasma.
entry.arxiv:comment: Opening Lecture, Hard Probes 2012, Cagliari, Sardinia, Italy, 27 May - 1 June 2012

entry.title: Hydrodynamic noise and Bjorken expansion
entry.summary: Using the Bjorken expansion model we study the effect of intrinsic hydrodynamic noise on the correlations observed in heavy-ion collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of Quark Matter 2012, (August 13-18, 2012, Washington DC), 4 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: Intermediate state interaction in the particle oscillations in absorbing matter
entry.summary: It is shown that the self-energy of intermediate particles plays a crucial role in the particle oscillations in absorbing matter.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 1 figure. arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1101.5566, arXiv:0910.0516

entry.title: Kinematic Moment of Inertia of e-e Rare Earths Nuclei
entry.summary: The kinematic moment of inertia of the rare earth even-even nuclei was calculated using three parametric energy based expression. The plot of kinematic moment of inertia versus nuclear spin shows a better sensitivity to back bending than energy plot.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 Figures, 1 Table

entry.title: Topics in Nuclear Structure
entry.summary: We consider work performed over the last decade on single-j-shell studies. We will discuss four topics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, two columns. Celebration of Prof. Raduta's 70th anniversary
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Romanian Journal of Physics, Vol. 58, Nos. 9-10, pp 1064-1075, 2013

entry.title: Investigation of Nuclear Phase transition with using Landau Theory
entry.summary: In this paper, Landau theory for phase transitions is shown to be a useful approach also for quantal system such as atomic nucleus. A detailed analysis of critical exponents of ground state quantum phase transition between and limits of interacting boson model is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Renormalization and power counting of chiral nuclear forces
entry.summary: I discuss the progress we have made on modifying Weinberg's prescription for chiral nuclear forces, using renormalization group invariance as the guideline. Some of the published results are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at The 7th International Workshop on Chiral Dynamics, Aug. 2012, Newport News, Virginia

entry.title: Magnetic Field Effects in Fermion Pairings
entry.summary: This paper considers various fermion pairings of interest for the QCD phases. The effects of an external magnetic field on the pairing mechanisms, on the realization of new condensates, and on the properties of the magnetized phases are all explored and discussed.

entry.title: Asymptotic Behaviors of Selected Unitary 9j Coefficients
entry.summary: We consider the behaviors of selected unitary 9 coefficients in the large j limit.

entry.title: New result for the neutron 9be capture at astrophysical energies
entry.summary: The total cross sections of the n9Be --> gamma10Be radiative capture are described in the framework of the modified potential cluster model (MPCM) with the classification of orbital states according to Young tableaux at thermal and astrophysical energies.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 p., 3 fig., 36 ref

entry.title: Computational challenges in the relativistic few-nucleon problem
entry.summary: I discuss computational challenges in the relativistic few-nucleon problem and the resolution of some of these challenges. I also discuss the outlook for the future.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 2 figures, proceedings of the International Conference on Nuclear Theory in the Supercomputing Era - 2013

entry.title: Derivation of breakup probabilities from experimental elastic backscattering data
entry.summary: We suggest simple and useful method to extract breakup probabilities from the experimental elastic backscattering probabilities in the reactions with toughly and weakly bound nuclei.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages

entry.title: Practical Calculation Scheme for Generalized Seniority
entry.summary: We propose a scheme or procedure for doing practical calculations with generalized seniority. It reduces the total computing time by calculating and storing in advance a set of intermediate quantities, taking advantage of the memory capability of modern computers. The requirements and performance of the algorithm are analyzed in detail.

entry.title: A short explanation of the Duflo-Zuker mass model
entry.summary: In this note we give a short introduction to the Duflo-Zuker shell model mass formula which has been shown to have great prediction power but is mostly used as a black box due to its complex nature.

entry.title: Comment on "K^- d -> pi Sigma n reactions and structure of the Lambda(1405)" by S. Ohnishi, Y. Ikeda, T. Hyodo, E. Hiyama, W. Weise
entry.summary: We strongly doubt the claimed priority of this work as the first full three-body calculation of the considered reaction.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page

entry.title: Basic phenomenology for relativistic heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: Basic concepts used to interpret the soft-hadronic data collected in relativistic heavy-ion collisions are reviewed at the elementary level.
entry.arxiv:comment: introductory lectures presented at the Cracow School of Theoretical Physics, LIV Course, 2014

entry.title: Systematic study of longitudinal and transverse helicity amplitudes in the hypercentral Constituent Quark Model
entry.summary: The predictions of the hypercentral Consituent Quark Model for the nucleon helicity amplitudes are briefly reported. Some future perspectives are also discussed.

entry.title: The Hypercentral Constituent Quark Model
entry.summary: The hypercentral Constituent Quark Model is presented and its application to the description of the electromagnetic properties of baryons is reviewed. The results concerning the elastic nucleon form factors and the electromagnetic excitation of baryon resonances are compared with the recent experimental data

entry.title: Elastic nucleon form factors
entry.summary: The relativized hypercentral Constituent Quark Model is used for the calculation of the elastic electromagnetic form factors of the nucleon. The results are compared with the recent measurements at Jlab.

entry.title: Electromagnetic form factors in the Hypercentral Constituent Quark Model
entry.summary: We discuss the recent experimental results on the ratio bertween the electric and magnetic proton form factors and how they can be described by the hypercentral Constituent Quark Model.

entry.title: Relativistic few-body methods
entry.summary: I discuss the role of relativistic quantum mechanics in few-body physics, various formulations of relativistic few-body quantum mechanics and how they are related.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to the \it 21-st International Conference on Few-Body Problems in Physics, 8 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: Comment on "Structure of the two-neutrino double-β decay matrix elements within perturbation theory" by Dušan Štefánik, Fedor Šimkovic, Amand Faessler, arXiv:1506.00835 [nucl-th], Phys.Rev.C91 (2015) 6, 064311
entry.summary: We comment on a priority claim given by the authors of Phys.Rev.C91 (2015) 6, 064311.

entry.title: Causal hydrodynamic fluctuation in Bjorken expansion
entry.summary: We investigate effects of causal hydrodynamic fluctuations in the longitudinally expanding quark gluon plasma on final entropy distributions in high-energy nuclear collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 3 figures, proceedings of the Quark Matter conference, September 27- October 3 2015, Kobe (Japan)

entry.title: Effective potential from zero-momentum potential
entry.summary: We obtain the centre-of-mass frame effective potential from the zero-momentum potential in Ruijsenaars-Schneider type 1-dimensional relativistic mechanics using classical inverse scattering methods.
entry.arxiv:comment: 24 pages, 10 figures

entry.title: Influence of Surface Tension on Nuclear Collective Properties
entry.summary: Rigidities of even-even nuclei were estimated and compared with nuclear charge radii. Correlation of maximal nuclear rigidities with minimal values of r0 parameters was revealed. Influence of effective surface tension on nuclear properties was discussed.

entry.title: Gamma Matrix Expansion of the Bethe-Salpeter Equation for Nucleon-Nucleon System
entry.summary: For the coefficients of the amplitude a set of simultaneous equations is derived in momentum space. By the auxiliary conditions they are equivalent to nonrelativistic equations and suitable for the investigation of two-nucleon system.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages

entry.title: Geometrical description of the phase transition in the Gaździcki Gorenstein model
entry.summary: The derivation of the phase transition in the model of Ga\'zdzicki and Gorenstein is generalized and simplified by using a geometrical construction.
entry.arxiv:comment: five pages, no fugures

entry.title: Nuclear Symmetry Energy Extracted from Laboratory Experiments
entry.summary: Some recent progress and open questions in extracting and understanding the new physics underlying the density dependence of nuclear symmetry energy from laboratory experiments are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: A feature article to appear in Nuclear Physics News

entry.title: Analytic matrix elements with shifted correlated Gaussians
entry.summary: Matrix elements between shifted correlated Gaussians of various potentials with several form-factors are calculated analytically. Analytic matrix elements are of importance for the correlated Gaussian method in quantum few-body physics.

entry.title: Hydrodynamics and critical slowing down
entry.summary: We introduce an effective theory which extends hydrodynamics into a regime where the critical slowing down would otherwise make hydrodynamics inapplicable.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 figure, Contribution to the Proceedings of the XXVI International Conference on Ultrarelativistic Nucleus-Nucleus Collisions (Quark Matter 2017), Feb 5-11, Chicago, U.S.A

entry.title: On the properties of the $^{229}$Th isotope
entry.summary: Electromagnetic properties of the deformed neutron-odd nucleus $^{229}$Th are investigated in the framework of the unified model, with primary emphasis upon the properties of the low-lying isomeric state.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, one figure

entry.title: Prolate over oblate dominance in deformed nuclei as a consequence of the SU(3) symmetry and the Pauli principle
entry.summary: We show that the dominance of prolate over oblate shapes in even-even deformed nuclei can be derived from the SU(3) symmetry and the Pauli principle.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages

entry.title: Quark Delocalization, Color Screening, and Nuclear Intermediate Range Attraction
entry.summary: We consider the effect of including quark delocalization and color screening, in the nonrelativistic quark cluster model, on baryon-baryon potentials and phase shifts. We find that the inclusion of these additional effects allows a good qualitative description of both.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, LaTeX, 4 figures in PostScript after text, LA-UR-91-2152

entry.title: Sum Rule Description of Color Transparency
entry.summary: The assumption that a small point-like configuration does not interact with nucleons leads to a new set of sum rules that are interpreted as models of the baryon-nucleon interaction. These models are rendered semi-realistic by requiring consistency with data for cross section fluctuations in proton-proton diffractive collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages + 3 postscript figures attached

entry.title: Self-consistent anisotropic oscillator with cranked angular and vortex velocities
entry.summary: The Kelvin circulation is the kinematical Hermitian observable that measures the true character of nuclear rotation. For the anisotropic oscillator, mean field solutions with fixed angular momentum and Kelvin circulation are derived in analytic form. The cranking Lagrange multipliers corresponding to the two constraints are the angular and vortex velocities. Self-consistent solutions are reported with a constraint to constant volume.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTex/RevTex, Phys. Rev. C46

entry.title: Magnetic Screening in Thermal Yang-Mills Theories
entry.summary: We develop a semiclassical method to calculate the density of magnetic monopoles in non-abelian gauge theories at finite temperature in the dilute gas approximation. This quantity is related to the inverse magnetic screening length for which we obtain $\mu_M = 0.255 g^2T$ in SU(2).
entry.arxiv:comment: 30 pages, 2 figures in separate PostScript file, DUKE-TH-92-42

entry.title: Hyperfine Populations Prior to Muon Capture
entry.summary: It is shown that the 1S level hyperfine populations prior to muon capture will be statistical when either target or beam are unpolarised independent of the atomic level at which the hyperfine interaction becomes appreciable. This assertion holds in the absence of magnetic transitions during the cascade and is true because of minimal polarisation after atomic capture and selective feeding during the cascade.
entry.arxiv:comment: (revtex, 6 preprint pages, no figures)

entry.title: Exact Solutions of Model Hamiltonian Problems with Effective Interactions
entry.summary: We demonstrate with soluble models how to employ the effective Hamiltonian approach of Lee and Suzuki to obtain all the exact eigenvalues of the full Hamiltonian. We propose a new iteration scheme to obtain the effective Hamiltonian and demonstrate its convergence properties.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages and 1 figure

entry.title: Model for the Quasifree Polarization-Transfer Measurements in the (p,n) reaction at 495 MeV
entry.summary: The recent (p,n) polarization transfer experiments at LAMPF are explained in terms of a dropping rho-meson mass in the medium.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages of text (LATEX), 4 figures (not included, available from the authors). February 1993

entry.title: Particle-particle correlations and the space-time structure of heavy ion collisions
entry.summary: The present status of the use of two-particle intensity interferometry as a diagnostic tool to study the space-time dynamics of intermediate energy heavy ion collisions is examined. Calculations for the two-proton and two-pion correlation functions are presented and compared to experiment. The calculations are based on the nuclear Boltzmann-Uehling-Uhlenbeck transport theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, Preprint MSUCL-864 (to be published in Progress in Particle and Nuclear Physics, Vol. 30)

entry.title: Diagonalization of full finite temperature Green's function by quasi-particles
entry.summary: For thermal systems, standard perturbation theory breaks down because of the absence of stable, observable asymptotic states. We show, how the introduction of {\it statistical} quasi-particles (stable, but not observable) gives rise to a consistent description. Statistical and spectral information can be cleanly separated also for interacting systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages in standard LaTeX

entry.title: Supershell Effect and Stability of Classical Periodic Orbits in Reflection-Asymmetric Superdeformed Oscillator
entry.summary: A semiclassical analysis is made of the origin of an undulating pattern in the smoothed level density for a reflection-asymmetric superdeformed oscillator potential. It is suggested that, when the octupole-type deformation increases, an interference effect between two families of periodic orbit with the ratio of periods approximately 2:1 becomes stronger and thus a pronounced ``supershell'' structure appears.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, PHYZZX, figures are not included, KUNS1196

entry.title: Approximate Particle Number Projection for Rotating Nuclei
entry.summary: Pairing correlations in rotating nuclei are discussed within the Lipkin-Nogami method. The accuracy of the method is tested for the Krumlinde-Szyma\'nski R(5) model. The results of calculations are compared with those obtained from the standard mean field theory and particle-number projection method, and with exact solutions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, 6 figures available on request, REVTEX3.0

entry.title: Localization of shadow poles by complex scaling
entry.summary: Through numerical examples we show that the complex scaling method is suited to explore the pole structure in multichannel scattering problems. All poles lying on the multisheeted Riemann energy surface, including shadow poles, can be revealed and the Riemann sheets on which they reside can be identified.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, Latex with Revtex, 3 figures (not included) available on request

entry.title: A Theorem on Light-Front Quantum Models
entry.summary: I give a sufficient condition for a relativistic front-form quantum mechanical model to be scattering equivalent (unitarily equivalent with the same S-matrix elements) to a relativistic front-form quantum model with an interaction-independent front-form spin.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, (TeX + PHYZZX macros)

entry.title: Quantum Interference Effects in N* Electroproduction and Propagation in Nuclei
entry.summary: We discuss the unexpected enhancement of the $N^*$ electroproduction on nuclei recently observed in the $(\gamma^*,p\pi^-)$ measurement. A mechanism which is able to explain this result is proposed. To clarify the situation, we suggest to perform a new kind of experiment within well specified kinematic conditions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages and 3 figures (available from the authors), FNT/T-93-19 University of Pavia

entry.title: Simple relativistic model of a finite-size particle
entry.summary: Soluble model of a relativistic particle describing a bag of matter with fixed radius held together in perfect balance by a self-consistent combination of three forces generated by electromagnetic and massive scalar and vector fields is presented. For realistic values of parameters the bag radius becomes that of a proton.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10pages + 3 postscript figures included in the file, uses RevTeX

entry.title: Exact response of the non-relativistic harmonic oscillator
entry.summary: Using Green$'$s function and operator techniques we give a closed expression for the response of a non-relativistic system interacting through confining, harmonic forces. The expression for the incoherent part permits rapid evaluation of coefficients in a 1/q expansion. A comparison is made with standard approximation methods.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9p.; INFN-ISS 93/2; WIS-93/50/Jun-PH

entry.title: Exotic Heavy Baryons at LHC?
entry.summary: We speculate about a heavy bottom-charm six-quark baryon. A semiclassical and a gaussian estimate reveal that the octet-octet bbb-ccc configuration can be energetically favored with respect to the singlet-singlet one. This result suggests that a confined bbb-ccc six-quark state may exist. Such objects may be produced in appreciable amount in heavy ion collisions at LHC energies.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 1 Figure, KFKI-1993-13/A, LaTeX (email: biro@theorie.physik.uni-giessen.de)

entry.title: Thermo Field Dynamics and Kinetic Coefficients of a Charged Boson Gas
entry.summary: Thermo Field Dynamics for inhomogeneous systems is generalized to quantum fields with a continuous single-particle mass spectrum. The modification of the hamiltonian in states with a local thermal Bogoliubov symmetry is used to calculate thermal conductivity and diffusion coefficient of pions interacting with hot, compressed nuclear matter.
entry.arxiv:comment: 27 pages in LaTeX GSI-Preprint 93-45 (1993)

entry.title: A Collective Model of Baryons
entry.summary: We propose an algebraic description of the geometric structure of baryons in terms of the algebra $U(7)$. We construct a mass operator that preserves the threefold permutational symmetry and discuss a collective model of baryons with the geometry of an oblate top.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages in Latex

entry.title: Proton halo of $^8$B in a microscopic model
entry.summary: The experimentally predicted existence of a proton halo in $^8$B is confirmed by dynamical microscopic multiconfiguration cluster model calculations. The thickness of the proton halo in $^8$B is 0.5 $fm$ while in $^8$Li a 0.4 $fm$ thick neutron halo has been found. It is shown that the huge quadrupole moment of $^8$B partly comes from the very distortable $^7$Be core.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, LATEX with REVTEX, submitted to Phys. Lett. B

entry.title: Mean Field Approximation to two-subsystems: Examples
entry.summary: Using the Funtional Integrals Formulation is developes a self-consistent mean field expansion to evolution operators of a system composed by two subsystems. This is a general expansion and can be generalized for more of two subsystems, which can be as system composed by fermions and bosons with an interaction between their ($\sigma$-model , $\sigma-\omega$ model or maser model) as a fermionic system with two or more different interactions between fermions particles, (NJL model ).
entry.arxiv:comment: 34 pages in LATEX, 2 figures

entry.title: Variational Methods for Nuclear Systems with Dynamical Mesons
entry.summary: We derive a model Hamiltonian whose ground state expectation value of any two-body operator coincides with that obtained with the Jastrow correlated wave function of the many-body Fermi system. Using this Hamiltonian we show that the variational principle can be extended to treat systems with dynamical mesons, even if in this case the concept of wave function looses its meaning.

entry.title: Pionic Bound States in Momentum Space
entry.summary: Bound states of the pion--nucleus system are investigated in momentum space using a microscopic optical potential with inherent energy dependences and nonlocalities arising from elementary potential models. The wave equation and computational techniques are tested, shallow levels are calculated, and a comparison is made with experiment. Deep levels are found to be deeper and broader than those in other investigations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages plus 6 ps figures available on request from lu@physics.orst.edu, OSU-TH-pibs

entry.title: Theory of Inclusive Scattering of Polarized Electrons by Polarized $^{3}$He and the Neutron Form Factors
entry.summary: The theory of inclusive lepton scattering of polarized leptons by polarized J = 1/2 hadrons is presented and the origin of different expressions for the polarized nuclear response function appearing in the literature is explained. The sensitivity of the longitudinal asymmetry upon the neutron form factors is investigated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 7 figures (to be requested), LateX, INFN-ISS 93/3

entry.title: Pairproduction in a semiclassical transport theory
entry.summary: In high-energy nucleon-nucleon-collisions large meson production rates are observed. As an alternative to meson exchange models here we propose a nonperturbative treatment of the quark-antiquark production from the mean field of colliding nucleon bags. Source terms for particles and antiparticles are developed in a semiclassical quark transport description and the time evolution of the quark density is studied for different mean fields numerically.

author.name: S. Loh T. S. Biro U. Mosel

entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, UGI-93-07

entry.title: A combined mathematica--fortran program package for analytical calculation of the matrix elements of the microscopic cluster model
entry.summary: We present a computer code that analytically evaluates the matrix elements of the microscopic nuclear Hamiltonian and unity operator between Slater determinants of displaced gaussian single particle orbits. Such matrix elements appear in the generator coordinate model and the resonating group model versions of the microscopic multicluster calculations.

entry.title: Neutron star properties from modern meson-exchange potential models
entry.summary: We calculate the total mass, radius, moment of inertia and surface gravitational redshift for neutron stars using various equations of state. The latter are derived from recent meson-exchange potential models, employing both a relativistic and a non-relativistic Brueckner-Hartree-Fock approach.
entry.arxiv:comment: 28 pages, elsevier latex style, report UIO-Phys-93-46

entry.title: The structure of the neutron deficient Sn isotopes
entry.summary: We calculate the spectra for the neutron deficient Sn isotopes with mass numbers from A=102 to A=108, using standard many-body techniques. The G-matrix used in the perturbative expansion was calculated using the Bonn potentials. A good agreement with the available data is obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, plain Latex, report UiO/PHYS/93-21

entry.title: Asymmetry of the Missing Momentum Distribution in (e,e$'$p) Reactions and Color Trnasparency
entry.summary: We suggest the measurement of the integrated asymmetry of teh missing momentum distribution in (e,e$'$p)reactions to check color transparency effects at intermediate momentum transfers.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages and 3 figures (available from the authors), FNT/T-93-19, University of Pavia

entry.title: Convergence properties of the effective interaction
entry.summary: The convergence properties of two perturbative schemes to sum the so-called folded diagrams are critically reviewed, with an emphasis on the intruder state problem. The methods we study are the approaches of Kuo and co-workers and Lee and Suzuki. The suitability of the two schemes for shell-model calculations are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages in revtex ver. 3.0. 3 figs can be obtained upon request. Univerisity of Oslo report UiO/PHYS/93-23

entry.title: Alpha Clustering and the stellar nucleosynthesis of carbon
entry.summary: The astrophysical S--factor and reaction rates for the triple--alpha process are calculated in the direct--capture model. It is shown that the stellar carbon production is extremely sensitive to small variations in the N--N interaction.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages LaTeX

entry.title: Identical Bands in Superdeformed Nuclei: A Relativistic Description
entry.summary: Relativistic Mean Field Theory in the rotating frame is used to describe superdeformed nuclei. Nuclear currents and the resulting spatial components of the vector meson fields are fully taken into account. Identical bands in neighboring Rare Earth nuclei are investigated and excellent agreement with recent experimental data is observed.

author.name: J. K"onig
author.arxiv:affiliation: Physik-Department der Technischen Universit"at M"unchen, D-8046 Garching, FRG

author.name: P. Ring
author.arxiv:affiliation: Physik-Department der Technischen Universit"at M"unchen, D-8046 Garching, FRG

entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages (Latex) and 4 figures (available upon request) TUM-ITP-Ko93/1

entry.title: Thermo Field Dynamics for Quantum Fields with Continuous Mass Spectrum applied to Nuclear Physics
entry.summary: Transport coefficients are obtained by incorporating a gauge principle into thermo field dynamics of inhomogeneous systems. In contrast to previous derivations, neither imaginary time arguments nor perturbation theory in powers of a coupling constant are used in the calculation. Numerical values are calculated for the pion component in hot nuclear matter.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages in LaTeX with two figures included as postscript code

entry.title: Two pion bound states in a hot pion gas
entry.summary: The occurrence of poles in the $2\pi$ propagator in a hot pion medium is studied. The domain of non--trivial solutions to the corresponding bosonic gap equation is investigated as a function of the chemical potential and temperature of the gas.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages with four figures (appended as uu-encoded compressed postscript files), Report WSU-NP-93-3

entry.title: Is Schrödinger's Conjecture for the Hydrogen Atom Coherent States Attainable
entry.summary: We construct the most general SO(4,2) hydrogen atom coherent states which are the counterpart of Schr\"{o}dinger's harmonic oscillator coherent states. We show that these states cannot be localized and cannot follow the classical orbits. Thus, Schr\"{o}dinger's conjecture for the hydrogen atom coherent states is unattainable.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, report #

entry.title: Inclusive Quasielastic and Deep Inelastic Scattering of Polarized Electrons by Polarized $^{3}$He}
entry.summary: A comprehensive treatement of the theoretical approach for describing nuclear effects in inclusive scattering of polarized electrons by polarized $^3$He is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages and 5 figs. (to be requested), LaTeX, INFN-ISS 93/5. To appear in Few Body Systems, Suppl

entry.title: Three-body resonances by complex scaling
entry.summary: It is demonstrated that the complex scaling method can be used in practical calculations to localize three-body resonances. Our model example emphasizes the fact that in three-body systems several essentially different asymptotic behaviors can appear. We show that the possibility of these different asymptotic configurations can lead to an apparent, resonance like structure in the three-body continuum.
entry.arxiv:comment: REVTEX, Submitted to Phys. Rev. C, 8 pages, 2 postscript figures are available upon request. ATOMKI-93/6

entry.title: The $πσ$-Axial Exchange Current
entry.summary: The axial exchange current operator that arises from the coupling of the axial field to the pion and effective scalar field in nuclei is constructed. The spatial dependence of this exchange current operator may be determined directly from the nucleon-nucleon interaction. This "$\pi\sigma$"-axial exchange current contributes about 5\% to the quenching of the nucleon axial current coupling constant $g_A^{GT}$ in heavy nuclei.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10pages, Latex file

entry.title: A Model Study of the Strength Distribution for a Collective State Coupled with Chaotic Background System
entry.summary: We consider a model in which a collective state couples to a large number of background states. The background states can be chosen to have properties which are classically characterized as regular or chaotic. We found that the dynamical nature of the background system considerably affects some fluctuation properties of the strength function. }
entry.arxiv:comment: 11pages, 4 figures (not included, available upon request), phyzzx macros, RCNP Preprint No.063

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on 'Comparison of potential models with the pp-scattering data below 350 MeV.' "
entry.summary: Replying to the above Comment by G.Q.Li and R.Machleidt, we point out that the supposed "flaws" in our Comparison of NN potential models with the pp- scattering data [ Phys.Rev.C47,761(1993) ] are in reality not flaws at all.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, Nijmegen report: THEF-NYM-93.11 [ Reply to nucl-th/9304022 ]

entry.title: The Multifragmentation Freeze--Out Volume in Heavy Ion Collisions
entry.summary: The reduced velocity correlation function for fragments from the reaction Fe + Au at 100 A~MeV bombarding energy is investigated using the dynamical--statistical approach QMD+SMM and compared to experimental data to extract the Freeze--Out volume assuming simultaneous multifragmentation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages; 3 uuencoded figures available with figures command, LateX, UCRL-J-11571

entry.title: RPA equations and the instantaneous Bethe-Salpeter equation
entry.summary: We give a derivation of the particle-hole RPA equations for an interacting multi-fermion system by applying the instantaneous approximation to the amputated two-fermion propagator of the system. In relativistic field theory the same approximation leads from the fermion-antifermion Bethe-Salpeter equation to the Salpeter equation. We show that RPA equations and Salpeter equation are indeed equivalent.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, RevTeX, Bonn TK-93-19

entry.title: Meson phase space density from interferometry
entry.summary: The interferometric analysis of meson correlations provides a measure of the average phase space density of the mesons in the final state. This quantity is a useful indicator of the statistical properties of the system, and it can be extracted with a minimum of model assumptions. Values obtained from recent measurements are consistent with the thermal value, but do not rule out superradiance effects.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4pages

entry.title: Resistance to Collapse: The Tensor Interaction
entry.summary: We consider negative-parity excitations in $^4\mbox{He}$, $J^{\pi}$=$0^-$ and $1^-$ with isospin $T$=$0$ and $T$=$1$. We show tha t, in contrast to one-particle one-hole results, in a shell model diagonalization none of the above collapses to zero energy as the strength of the tensor interaction is increased.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, latex file, 1 figure (available upon request), RU9407

entry.title: Simple Formula for Nuclear Charge Radius
entry.summary: A new formula for the nuclear charge radius is proposed, dependent on the mass number (A) and neutron excess (N-Z) in the nucleus. It is simple and it reproduces all the experimentally available mean square radii and their isotopic shifts of even--even nuclei much better than other frequently used relations.

author.name: B. Nerlo-Pomorska
author.arxiv:affiliation: The Maria Curie-Sklodowska University, Lublin, Poland

author.name: K. Pomorski
author.arxiv:affiliation: The Maria Curie-Sklodowska University, Lublin, Poland

entry.arxiv:comment: The paper contains 7 pages in LateX and 6 figures (available upon request) in postscript. Email: pomorski@golem.umcs.lublin.pl

entry.title: Electroproductions of Light $Λ$- and $Σ$-Hypernuclei
entry.summary: Theoretical estimations of production cross sections of light $\Lambda$ and $\Sigma$ hypernuclei in $(e,e'K^{+})$ reactions at around CEBAF energies are given. Because of dominant spin-flip amplitudes and large momentum transfers, unnatural parity states and stretched states of hypernuclei are favorably excited. They are compared with quasifree hyperon productions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages in Latex(6 figures are available on request

entry.title: Suppression of Hadroproduction in Nuclei
entry.summary: We argue that nuclei are not transparent for fast projectile partons. Color transparency is effective for final state interactions in heavy particle production, though nuclear filtering of initial partons can reduce the cross sections. We show that short-ranged initial state interactions, which have been neglected so far, can be important in hadroproduction on nuclei. With the present scenario of hadroproduction a qualitative description of data can be obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTex, two figures available upon request, MKPH-T-94-1

entry.title: Fragmentation model and quark/hadron system
entry.summary: Nuclear multifragmentation process can be viewed as a recombination of nucleons into clusters of various sizes. In a combinatorial analysis, various moments of cluster size distribution appear to be quite simple in terms of canonical partition functions. This simple model can also describe a branching phenomena and a clusterization phenomena. The possibility of applying this fragmentation model in describing a hadronization of quark-gluon system and a strangeness production is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: LATEX 10 pages

entry.title: Fission fragment orientation and gamma ray emission anisotropy
entry.summary: Experimental data on angular distributions of gamma rays emitted from binary and ternary spontaneous fission of $^{252}{\rm Cf}$ are analyzed. Their difference indicates that the alignment of fragments is higher in ternary fission than in binary one. The consequences of possible relation between the mechanism of ternary fission and the excitation of collective modes during the saddle-to-scission stage are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages of text (LATEX), 5 figures (not included, available from the author), Preprint IAE-5670/2, 1993

entry.title: BRST Treatment of the Bohr Collective Hamiltonian at High Spins
entry.summary: The BRST treatment of triaxial systems rotating at high spins is used to solve perturbatively the $\gamma$-independent Bohr collective hamiltonian.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages in LaTeX using Esp-LaTeX and Feynman packages

entry.title: Do parton cascade model results approach chemical equilibrium?
entry.summary: This comment is withdrawn, as the figure on which it was based is inconsistent with other figures in the text and thus probably incorrect. Using the other figures, I find that the parton cascade model does approach chemical equilibrium correctly.
entry.arxiv:comment: KSUCNR-005-94

entry.title: Scaling Law in Cluster Decay
entry.summary: A recently proposed scaling law for the decay time of alpha particles is generalized for cluster decay. It is shown that for the decay of even-even parents, $logT_{1/2}$ depends linearly on the scaling variable S=(Z$_{c}$Z$_{d})^{0.6}/\sqrt{Q_{c}}$ and on the square root of the reduced mass of cluster and daughter.
entry.arxiv:comment: REVTEX, 9 pages, 2 Postscript (uuencoded) figures

entry.title: A Revisit of SO(6) Dynamical Symmetry in Nuclear Structure
entry.summary: According to the analysis based on the fermion dynamical symmetry model, nuclei previously regarded as SO(6)-like (e.g. $^{128}$Xe and $^{196}$Pt) are shown to be more akin to the transitional nuclei between SO(7) and SO(6) symmetries.

entry.title: Direct mechanism in solar nuclear reactions
entry.summary: A short overview of the direct reaction mechanism and the models used for the analysis of such processes is given. Nuclear reactions proceeding through the direct mechanism and involved in solar hydrogen burning are discussed. The significance of these nuclear reactions with respect to the solar neutrino problem is investigated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, LaTeX, 5 figures available upon request to gruen@ekpvs2.una.ac.at, IK/TUW-Preprint 9404403

entry.title: Comment on "No-core calculations" of the spectra of light nuclei
entry.summary: We comment upon a recent work by Zheng, Barrett, Jaqua, Vary and McCarthy, concerning calculations of spectra of light nuclei with no core. It is demonstrated that the omission of particle-particle ladder diagrams in their calculations, explains the large differences between results obtained with various model spaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, Revtex 3.0, UIO/PHYS report 94-10

entry.title: Laboratory Mesurements in Nuclear Astrophysics
entry.summary: After reviewing some of the basic concepts, nomenclatures and parametrizations of Astronomy, Astrophysics and Cosmology, we introduce a few central problems in Nuclear Astrophysics, including the hot-CNO cycle, helium burning in massive stars, and solar neutrino's. We demonstarte that SECONDARY (RADIOACTIVE) NUCLEAR BEAMS allow for considerable progress on these problems.
entry.arxiv:comment: (GAI @ UConnVM.UConn.EDU). Lecture Notes, Muju Resort Summer School, Korea, 20-25 August, 1993, and III Nankai Summer School, 1-10 Septemebr, 1993. LaTEX file, 51 pages, 36 figures, 92 references

entry.title: Quenching of spin operators in the calculation of radiative corrections for nuclear beta decay
entry.summary: Calculations of the axial-vector component to the radiative correction for superallowed Fermi $0^+ \rightarrow 0^+$ nuclear beta decay are here modified with quenched rather than free-nucleon coupling constants for the axial-vector and electromagnetic interactions with nucleons. The result increases the deduced value of $V_{ud}$ but does not restore unitarity in the CKM matrix.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 7 pages, no figures, TASCC-P-94-11

entry.title: Mean-field description of ground-state properties of drip-line nuclei. (I) Shell-correction method
entry.summary: A shell-correction method is applied to nuclei far from the beta stability line and its suitability to describe effects of the particle continuum is discussed. The sensitivity of predicted locations of one- and two-particle drip lines to details of the macroscopic-microscopic model is analyzed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 REVTeX pages, 13 uuencoded postscript figures available upon request

entry.title: Shape Coexistence Around $^{44}_{16}$S$_{28}$: The Deformed N=28 Region
entry.summary: Masses, deformations, radii, and single-particle properties of the very neutron-rich Sulfur isotopes are investigated in the framework of the selfconsistent mean-field theory. The stability of the N=28 magic gap around $^{44}$S is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: (12 REVTeX pages; 5 PostScript figures available upon request.)

entry.title: Chiral and Gluon Condensates at Finite Temperature
entry.summary: We investigate the thermal behaviour of gluon and chiral condensates within an effective Lagrangian of pseudoscalar mesons coupled to a scalar glueball. This Lagrangian mimics the scale and chiral symmetries of QCD. (Submitted to Z. Phys. C)
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages + 7 figures (uuencoded compressed postscript files), University of Regensburg preprint TPR-94-14

entry.title: Downloading the Nuclear Structure Shell Model Code OXBASH from INTERNET
entry.summary: This document explains how to download the OXBASH code for nuclear structure calculations from the NSCL anonymous server and get it running on VAX (VMS), ALPHA (OpenVMS) and IBM RS/6000 (aix) computers. The physics behind the code is explained in the OXBASH manual, which is part of the downloading package. Everybody is welcome to download the code and use it under the conditions described below.
entry.arxiv:comment: text file

entry.title: The nucleon as a relativistic quark-diquark bound state with an exchange potential
entry.summary: Treating the quark and diquark as elementary particles, the Bethe-Salpeter equation for the nucleon is solved numerically. The dependence of the mass on the diquark mass and on the coupling constants is investigated. The resulting relativistic quark-diquark-nucleon vertex is presented and discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, herman.meyer@rphs1.physik.uni-regensburg.de

entry.title: Chiral perturbation in dense matter and meson condensation controversy
entry.summary: An outstanding problem in the study of possible kaon condensation is the striking discrepancy between the results of chiral perturbation theory and those of the PCAC-plus-current-algebra approach. I discuss here what causes this discrepancy and what needs to be done to solve the problem. In addition, I point out the importance of examining the validity of the non-relativistic approximation universally employed in the existing treatments of kaon condensation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, USC(NT)-94-5

entry.title: Exotic Atom Formation in External Electric Fields
entry.summary: Validity of the coalescence model of exotic atom formation in the ion collisions is studied . An estimate is given for the rates of P state production in the electric fields of the colliding ions . Possibilities of quantum beat effects are indicated . The results may be of interest in the experimental search for pionium.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 LaTeX pages with two figures

entry.title: Electromagnetic Form Factor of the Nucleon in the Time-like Region
entry.summary: We explore the possibility to verify vector meson dominance for the nucleon by measuring the half-off-shell form factor in the vector-meson mass region. Cross sections for the process $\gamma p \rightarrow p + e^+e^-$ be presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 LATEX pages, 4 figures available from ftp://theorie.physik.uni-giessen.de/

entry.title: Threshold Photo/Electro Pion Production - Working Group Summary
entry.summary: We summarize the pertinent experimental and theoretical developments in the field of pion photo- and electroproduction in the threshold region. We discuss which experiments and which calculations should be done/performed in the future.
entry.arxiv:comment: plain TeX (macro included), 6pp, summary talk presented at the workshop on "Chiral Dynamics: Theory and Experiments", MIT, July 25-29, 1994

entry.title: Two-Nucleon Solitary Wave Exchange Potentials(SWEPs)
entry.summary: A sine-Gordon solitary wave exchange NN potentials (SG SWEP) is presented as an example of a large class of realistic potentials with four or less parameters. SWEPs are derived from nonlinear quantum field theory developed by Burt. SG SWEPs resemble Reid SC potentials and they reproduce high quality phase shifts and deuteron parameters with only two parameters.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 Revtex pages, Win-U-94-0917

entry.title: Efimov States in Halo Nuclei
entry.summary: We investigate conditions for the occurrence of Efimov states in the recently discovered halo nuclei. These states could appear in systems, where one neutron is added to a pronounced one-neutron halo nucleus. Detailed calculations of the properties of the states are presented and promising candidates are discussed.

author.name: D. V. Fedorov
author.arxiv:affiliation: IFA, Aarhus University, DK-8000 Aarhus C, Denmark

author.name: A. S. Jensen
author.arxiv:affiliation: IFA, Aarhus University, DK-8000 Aarhus C, Denmark

author.name: K. Riisager
author.arxiv:affiliation: IFA, Aarhus University, DK-8000 Aarhus C, Denmark

entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, compressed and uuencoded PostScript file, IFA-94/30

entry.title: The Onset of Chaos with a Quadrupole--Quadrupole Interaction
entry.summary: The transition from order to chaos in atomic nuclei has been studied analytically and numerically using a quadrupole--quadrupole residual interaction. This interaction leads to chaotic behaviour, but the critical energy $E_C\simeq 12.6$ MeV, corresponding to the onset of chaos, is higher than that of the experimental one.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 5 figures (available upon request to the authors), LaTex, DFPD/93/TH/73, to be published in Nuovo Cimento A

entry.title: Binding energies and nonradiative decay rates of $H\! edμ$-molecular ions
entry.summary: The method of hyperspherical "surface" functions has been applied to the calculation of eigenvalues and eigenfunctions of muonic molecular ions $^{3,4}\! H\! ed\mu $. Binding energies and nonradiative decay rates for the states of the total angular momentum $L=0,~1,~2$ have been obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, RevTeX

entry.title: Few-Body Physics -- Then and Now
entry.summary: A summary of the XIV\underline{th} International Conference on Few-body Problems In Physics is given, with an emphasis on the important problems solved recently and the prognosis for the future of the field. Personal remarks and ``homework'' problem assignments are made.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, 1 fig., LA-UR-94-2132

entry.title: Fine Structure Discussion of Parity-Nonconserving Neutron Scattering at Epithermal Energies
entry.summary: The large magnitude and the sign correlation effect in the parity non-conserving resonant scattering of epithermal neutrons from $^{232}$Th is discussed in terms of a non-collective $2p-1h$ local doorway model. General conclusions are drawn as to the probability of finding large parity violation effects in other regions of the periodic table.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, Tex. CTP# 2296, to appear in Z. Phys. A

entry.title: Isospin Recoupling and Bose-Einstein Pion Correlations in Nucleon-Antinucleon Annihilations
entry.summary: We study the effect of isospin projections on a two source picture of coherent pions coming from nucleon-antinucleon annihilation. We show that important Hanbury-Brown Twiss correlations among like charge pion pairs compared with unlike arise from these isospin projections.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, PSI-PR-94-34, submitted to Phys.Rev.C

entry.title: Charge Exchange Processes between Excited Helium and Fully Stripped Ions
entry.summary: We made a classical trajectory Monte Carlo (CTMC) calculation of state selective cross sections for processes between some light ions and excited helium. The results, useful for analysis of spectroscopic data of fusion devices, are in good agreement with theoretical predictions of scaling laws.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTex, 8 pages, 4 figures (available on request to the authors), DFPD/94/TH/57, to be published in Phys. Rev. A

entry.title: Where the Nuclear Pions are
entry.summary: Three recent experiments, which looked at pionic effects in nuclei have concluded that there are no excess pions. This puts into serious question the conventional meson-exchange picture of the nucleon-nucleon interaction. Based on arguments of partial restoration of chiral symmetry with density we propose a resolution to this problem.
entry.arxiv:comment: 24 pages, Stony Brook preprint SUNY-NTG-94-54

entry.title: Closed shells at drip-line nuclei
entry.summary: The shell structure of magic nuclei far from stability is discussed in terms of the self-consistent spherical Hartree-Fock-Bogoliubov theory. In particular, the sensitivity of the shell-gap sizes and the two-neutron separation energies to the choice of particle-hole and particle-particle components of the effective interaction is investigated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages, LaTeX, 8 uuencoded figures available upon request

entry.title: Enhancement of low-${m_t}$ kaons in AGS heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: In the relativistic transport model, we show that the recently observed enhancement of low-$m_t$ kaons ($K^+$ and $K^-$) in Si+Pb collisions at AGS can be explained if a density isomer is introduced in the nuclear equation-of-state.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, RevTex, 6 figs on request to gqli@comp.tamu.edu

entry.title: Charge Radii of Hyperons
entry.summary: The momentum projected SU(3) Chiral Color Dielectric Model (CCDM) is employed to calculate the charge root mean square radii and charge distributions of hyperons. We compare our result with Skyrme, MIT bag and Cloudy Bag model results. The charge distribution of $\Lambda$ in CCDM is similar to that of Skyrme Model prediction.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, LaTeX, 3 figures upon request

entry.title: An explanatory study of $^{11}$Li $β$ decay into $^9$Li and deuteron
entry.summary: The $\beta$-decay of $^{11}$Li into $^9$Li and {\it d} is studied using simple halo wave functions of $^{11}$Li. The sensitivity of the transition probability is elucidated on a description of the halo part and on a choice of the potential between $^9$Li and {\it d} .
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages,revtex,2 figures (available upon request)

entry.title: The Effective Non-Relativistic Hamiltonian for Electron-Nucleus Interaction
entry.summary: We present the effective Hamiltonian for an electron-nucleus interaction in non-relativistic limit up to the second order in the inverse nucleon mass. This Hamiltonian takes into account the distortion of electron waves and allows to calculate its effect as well as matrix elements for off-shell transitions in $(e,e'p)$ reactions.

author.name: R. Ya. Kezerashvili
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita'di Pisa and INFN, Sezione di Pisa

entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Temperatures of Fragment Kinetic Energy Spectra
entry.summary: Multifragmentation reactions without large compression in the initial state (proton-induced reactions, reverse-kinematics, projectile fragmentation) are examined, and it is verified quantitatively that the high temperatures obtained from fragment kinetic energy spectra and lower temperatures obtained from observables such as level population or isotope ratios can be understood in a common framework.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 7 pages, 2 figures available from author

entry.title: String Models for Ultrarelativistic Hadronic Interactions: Concepts, Limitations, and New Directions
entry.summary: After a brief description of the basic theoretical concepts of the string model approach, we discuss the limitations of the method, at low energies, at high energies, and at high particle densities. We also report on recent efforts to overcome these limitations.
entry.arxiv:comment: Complete paper enclosed as postscript file (uuencoded). Invited Lecture at the International Workshop on Multi-Particle Correlations and Nuclear Reactions, CORINNE II, 6.-10. Sept. 1994, Nantes, France

entry.title: Is Large Weak Mixing in Heavy Nuclei Consistent with Aiomic Experiments?
entry.summary: The hypothesis of a large weak matrix element between single-particle states in heavy nuclei ($\sim 100$ eV) contradicts the results of atomic PNC experiments.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, latex (revtex), no figures

entry.title: Hydrodynamic Evolution of Chirally Symmetric Nuclear Matter
entry.summary: The equation of state of the linear sigma model in the mean field approximation is used as input in a relativistic hydrodynamical numerical routine. Longitudinal and transverse energy distributions are calculated and compared with those obtained from the QHD-I equation of state.
entry.arxiv:comment: talk presented at the 5$^{th}$ workshop on hadronic interactions, Sao Paulo, 1-3 Dec. 1994. 6 pages, figures included. Format: compressed and uuencoded postscript file

entry.title: Revisit of Coulomb effects on pi^{-}/pi^{+} ratio in heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: It is shown that the large $\pi^{-}/\pi^{+}$ ratio at low pion energies recently observed in the reaction of Au+Au at $E_{beam}/A=1.0$ GeV at SIS/GSI is due to the strong Coulomb field of the reaction system.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTex, 7 pages, 4 figures are available from the Author upon request, Phys. Lett. B in press.

entry.title: SOME ASPECTS OF ANTIPROTON--NUCLEUS PHYSICS
entry.summary: A brief review of antiproton--nucleus physics is presented. Some topics are related to early LEAR experiments, and others to more recent measurements or proposals. These include: exotic molecules, elastic and inelastic scattering, deep annihilation, strangeness production, neutron--antineutron oscillations, halo nuclei, antiproton production in nuclear reactions etc.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7pages, ordinary LATEX (some macros included); no figures

entry.title: Faddeev approach to the octet and decuplet baryons
entry.summary: A relativistic Faddeev model for the baryon octet is extended to treat the baryon decuplet. We find that after determining the model parameters in the mesonic sector the masses of both nucleon and delta deviate by less than 5\% from the experimental data and show only a very weak dependence on the constituent quark mass.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages

entry.title: Are there eta-Helium bound states?
entry.summary: Using multiple scattering theory the scattering lengths of $\eta$ mesons on helium nuclei are calculated and checked against final state $\eta$ interactions from the $pd \rightarrow \eta ^3$He and $dd \rightarrow \eta ^4$He reactions. The existence of an $\eta^4$He quasibound state is indicated.
entry.arxiv:comment: revtex, 23 pages, 3 figures available by fax or mail

entry.title: Theories for multiple resonances
entry.summary: Two microscopic theories for multiple resonances in nuclei are compared, n-particle-hole RPA and quantized Time-Dependent Hartree-Fock (TDHF). The Lipkin-Meshkov-Glick model is used as test case. We find that quantized TDHF is superior in many respects, except for very small systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 Pages, 3 figures available upon request.

entry.title: NUCLEAR THEORY WHITE PAPER 1995
entry.summary: We review the accomplishments of nuclear theory during the past five years and identify the future challenges and research opportunities. [Final, substantially revised version of the nuclear theory white paper]
entry.arxiv:comment: 33 pages, LaTeX, 6 figures in uuencoded PostScript files

entry.title: Muonic molecules of charge Z >= 3: Coulombic properties and nuclear transitions.
entry.summary: In this report we will discuss properties of and models for nuclear transitions in muonic molecules formed via collisions of muonic atoms of hydrogen isotopes with light nuclei like $L\!i$ and $B\!e$. Their importance for nuclear astrophysics and nuclear physics at super low energies is emphasized.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages, 16 figures (available by post)

entry.title: Strong and Electromagnetic Interactions
entry.summary: Elements of a new model of strong interactions are described. The model is based on an extension of electrodynamics that is derived from a regular Lagrangian density. Here the electric and magnetic fields of Maxwell equations play a symmetric role. It is shown that results are in accordance with general properties of nuclear and nucleon systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 24 pages, no figure

entry.title: Order and Chaos in Roto--Vibrational States of Atomic Nuclei
entry.summary: Using a classical analytical criterion (that of curvature) and numerical results (Poincar\`e sections and spectral statistics), a transition order--chaos--order in the roto--vibrational model of atomic nuclei has been shown. Numerical calculations were performed for some deformed nuclei.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTex, 6 figures (available on request), accepted for publication in Int. J. Mod. Phys. E

entry.title: Boson-fermion mapping of collective fermion-pair algebras
entry.summary: We construct finite Dyson boson-fermion mappings of general collective algebras extended by single-fermion operators. A key element in the construction is the implementation of a similarity transformation which transforms boson-fermion images obtained directly from the supercoherent state method. In addition to the general construction, we give detailed applications to SO(2N), SU(l+1), SO(5), and SO(8) algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, latex, no figures

entry.title: Enhancement of low-mass dileptons in heavy-ion collisions
entry.summary: Using a relativistic transport model for the expansion stage of S+Au collisions at 200 GeV/nucleon, we show that the recently observed enhancement of low-mass dileptons by the CERES collaboration can be explained by the decrease of vector meson masses in hot and dense hadronic matter.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, RevTeX, 3 figures available from gqli@comp.tamu.edu

entry.title: Comment on ``Large-space shell-model calculations for light nuclei''
entry.summary: In a recent publication Zheng, Vary, and Barrett reproduced the negative quadrupole moment of Li-6 and the low-lying positive-parity states of He-5 by using a no-core shell model. In this Comment we question the meaning of these results by pointing out that the model used is inadequate for the reproduction of these properties.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex with Revtex, 1 postscript figure in separate file

entry.title: The Phase Transition to the Quark-Gluon Plasma and Its Effect on Hydrodynamic Flow
entry.summary: It is shown that in ideal relativistic hydrodynamics a phase transition from hadron to quark and gluon degrees of freedom in the nuclear matter equation of state leads to a minimum in the excitation function of the transverse collective flow.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, latex, 7 uuencoded figures

entry.title: Nuclear Shell Model Calculations with Fundamental Nucleon-Nucleon Interactions
entry.summary: Some fundamental Nucleon-Nucleon interactions and their applications to finite nuclei are reviewed. Results for the few-body systems and from Shell-Model calculations are discussed and compared to point out the advantages and disadvantages of the different Nucleon-Nucleon interactions. The recently developed Drexel University Shell Model (DUSM) code is mentioned.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 4 figures. To appear in Phys. Rep. 1995

entry.title: Pre-Equilibrium Particle Emission and Critical Exponent Analysis
entry.summary: In two different phase transition models of nuclear fragmentation we show that the emission of pre-equilibrium particles and mixing of events from different classes cannot be ignored in the analysis of nuclear fragmentation data in terms of critical exponents, and we show how the apparent values of the extracted exponents are affected.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages + 4 postscript figures (uuencoded and included)

entry.title: On the balance of the solar p-p chain
entry.summary: I show that the solar neutrino fluxes, predicted by standard nuclear and solar physics, can get closer to the experimental observations if one takes the freedom to introduce two free parameters into the model, as it is done in the MSW solution. I point out that the plasma electron capture of Be7 and the He3(He3,2p)He4 nuclear reactions deserve further experimental and theoretical attention.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex with Revtex

entry.title: Rho-Omega Mixing Off Shell and Charge Symmetry Breaking In the N-N Potential
entry.summary: The role of the off-shell dependence of $\rho-\omega$ mixing in the charge symmetry breaking nucleon-nucleon potential is discussed. It is shown that models describing the off-shell dependence of $\rho-\omega$ mixing are not sufficient to determine the charge symmetry breaking nucleon-nucleon potential.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, revtex, no figures

entry.title: On the Numerical Solution of the Time-Dependent Schroedinger Equation
entry.summary: An algorithm for the numerical solution of the Schr\"odinger equation in the case of a time dependent potential is proposed. Our simple modification upgrades the well known method of Koonin while negligibly increasing the computing time. In the presented test the accuracy is enhanced by up to an order of magnitude.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Revtex, Published in J. Comp. Physics 119, (1995) p. 206-208

entry.title: Delta Excitations in Neutrino-Nucleus Scattering
entry.summary: We derive the contribution of $\Delta$-h excitations to quasielastic charged-current neutrino-nucleus scattering in the framework of relativistic mean-field theory. We discuss the effect of $\Delta$ production on the determination of the axial mass $M_A$ in neutrino scattering experiments.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, revtex, 3 postscript figures (available upon request)

entry.title: Effects of mass renormalization on the surface properties of heavy-ion fusion potential
entry.summary: We discuss the effects of fast nuclear excitations on heavy-ion fusion reactions at energies near and below the Coulomb barrier. Using the fusion of two $^{40}$Ca nuclei as an example and the inversion method, we show that the mass renormalization induced by fast nuclear excitations leads to a large surface diffuseness in the effective potential for heavy-ion fusion reactions.

author.name: K. Hagino
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Physics, Tohoku University, Sendai, Japan

author.name: N. Takigawa
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Physics, Tohoku University, Sendai, Japan

entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, Latex

entry.title: Charge Symmetry Violation in Nuclear Physics
entry.summary: The study of charge symmetry violation in nuclear physics is a potentially enormous subject. Through a few topical examples we aim to show that it is not a subject of peripheral interest but rather goes to the heart of our understanding of hadronic systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at the Int. Conference on Weak and Electromagnetic Interactions in Nuclei, Osaka, June 12-16 1995

entry.title: phi-meson in Nuclear Matter
entry.summary: $\phi$-meson mass in nuclear matter ($m_{\phi}^*$) is investigated using an effective Lagrangian of $\phi$ interacting with octet baryons. $m_{\phi}^*$ decreases by a few \% in nuclear matter due to the current conservation and effective nucleon/hyperon masses. Its implication to the p-A and A-A collisions are briefly discussed.

author.name: H. Kuwabara
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics, Univ. of Tsukuba

author.name: T. Hatsuda
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics, Univ. of Tsukuba

entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, latex, 3 postscript figures, submitted to Prog. Theor. Phys

entry.title: Kaon Energies in Dense Matter
entry.summary: We discuss the role of kaon-nucleon and nucleon-nucleon correlations in kaon condensation in dense matter. Correlations raise the threshold density for kaon condensation, possibly to densities higher than those encountered in stable neutron stars.
entry.arxiv:comment: RevTeX, 11 pages, 2 PostScript figures; manuscript also available, in PostScript form, at http://www.nordita.dk/locinfo/preprints.html

entry.title: Pion correlation from Skyrmion-AntiSkyrmion annihilation
entry.summary: We study two pion correlations from Skyrmion and antiSkyrmion collision, using the product ansatz and an approximate random grooming method for nucleon projection. The spatial-isospin coupling inherent in the Skyrme model, along with empirical averages, leads to correlations not only among pions of like charges but also among unlike charge types.
entry.arxiv:comment: uuencoded files of REVTeX and postscript, 18 pages including 2 figures, submitted to Phys.Rev.C

entry.title: Nuclear Responses to Electro-Weak Probes and In-Medium Chiral Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: We discuss two topics concerning the application of chiral perturbation theory to nuclear physics: (1) the latest developments in the study of possible kaon condensation in dense baryonic systems; (2) nuclear responses to electro-weak probes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, invited talk at WEIN'95, Osaka, Japan

entry.title: Symmetry Problems in Low Energy Physics
entry.summary: Some recent experimental and theoretical work on 1) charge symmetry-breaking, 2) parity non-conservation, and 3) searches for breaking of time reversal invariance are reviewed. The examples illustrate the uses of symmetry to learn about underlying dynamics and/or structure.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, tex, figures available from liebert@alpher.npl.washington.edu Talk presented at WEIN'95
